column1: short and swinging into the hips, glanced away in the air past the right of short leg
good length, angling in from over the wicket, and swinging away against the angle past the outside edge as Elgar feels for the ball
fuller than a good length and largely holds its line on off stump, tip and run to the covers
Amir finds inswing again, on a length and moves back in, Markram closes his face and blocks with soft hands to short leg
pitched up and angling across off, Markram shelves the drive and lets it go in the channel
good length and angling away, much closer to off, Markram opens the face and runs the ball away to point
overpitched and angling away outside off, gentle loosener, Elgar reaches out for the ball and drives straight of mid-off. The ball rolls away to the fence
back of a length and slanting away outside off, Elgar shoulders arms to it
pitched up and nipping away outside off, no shot again from Elgar

Abbas strikes with his fourth ball and finds the outside edge of Elgar. Good length and angling across off, seaming away. Elgar feels for the ball and tickles it behind. Sarfraz snaffles it and Abbas roars in delight. After leaving the previous two balls, Elgar nicks this one off
on a good length and angling in at off stump, Amla presses forward and defends it back to the bowler
Abbas attacks off stump, Amla covers up in defence and blocks it back
short and angling away outside off, Markram uses his height, rises on top of the ball and punches to cover
much fuller and angling across off, no shot
back of a length and angling away just a shade outside off, Markram keeps back and forces the ball in the gap at the covers
shorter and on off, Markram fends it off

Dropped at short leg. Back of a length and swings back into Markram, he jabs at it. The ball flies to Masood, the ball hits his right hand and goes down. The ball simply flew to Masood. Was simply too quick for him to wrap his hands around the ball. Difficult chance. Such ones stick... or they just don't
much fuller and swinging in, Markram is careful in defence now
Amla gets on top of a short ball outside off and sweetly punches through the covers
pitched up and nibbles in a touch at off, Amla dead-bats it away
veering into the pads now as Amla neatly picks it away to long leg
back of a length, angling in, then straightening away outside off, jabbed towards point off the back foot
good length and angling into a solid push to mid-on off the front foot
tip and run to the covers off the back foot. Smartly done, Markram and Amla
bouncer on leg stump, Markram ducks under it
dug in short on leg and middle, cramps the batsman for room. He sits back and fends it back to Amir
pitched up and angling across off, run away to point
shorter and angling across off, Markram loosens the grip and pats it to the covers with soft hands
short and kicks up at leg stump, fended back to the bowler again
back of a length and angling away just outside off, pressed into the covers
full on a fourth-stump line, Amla gets forward to defend to cover
Abbas plugs away just outside off, Amla deploys a solid stride and blocks
Abbas goes wide of the crease, gets it to nip back in from outside off. It does not threaten off, so Amla lets it go without much fuss
floated full and outside off, left alone again
very full and homing in on off, played back to Abbas
Amla jumps across off and diffuses a back of a length ball on off
Amir finds inswing, hits a hard length, and hits Markram on the mid-riff. Back of a length and moves back in, inside-edged onto the body. Ouch
back of a length and skids back in to tuck up the batsman for room, jabbed on the bounce to short leg
floated fuller and angling away outside off, ignored
short on the hips, clipped away in the air.... but past the right of Masood at short leg
pitched up and curling away outside off, Amla has nothing to do with it. No drive. Nothing
shorter and angling across off, no shot from Amla once again
good length and angling in at off and middle, played back watchfully
overpitched and outside off, Markram leans into it and laces it away through extra-cover. Handsome drive from Markram
full and wobbles away outside off, takes the outside edge and streaks away past the cordon towards third man
chest-high short ball on leg stump, Markram swivels on the back foot and splices a hook to the long leg boundary
back of a length and swerves back in, Markram jabs at it and gets an inside edge onto the pad
full and outside off, dropped into the covers for one
full and holds its line outside off, Markram lets it go
back of a length and zips back in from outside off as Hasan hits the deck harder. The batsman lets it go once again
good length and coming in at middle, Markram goes forward and across in defence
back of a length and angling into middle, Markram keeps back and punchily plays it to mid-on
half-volley outside off, Markram latches onto it and drills a cover drive. Stretches out and crunches it to the boundary
full and swinging in at middle and leg, tapped to mid-on
full and holds its line outside off, Amla prods and edges it but it does not carry to the slips
full on a fourth-stump line, Amla defends stoutly off the front foot
on the pads, chipped away from the reach of short leg as the ball rolls to midwicket
full and angling into off, played back off the front foot
full and Abbas targets off stump again, Markram's solid defence intervenes
short and outside off, fended to leg
Markram gets on top of a short ball outside off and solidly punches it away behind point for four
once again. Shot and outside off, Markram rides the bounce and jabs it away behind point for back-to-back fours
very full and swings in at off stump, played back to Ali
full and angling in at off, stabbed back to the bowler
Loose bowling from Pakistan. Quality batting from Markram. He sizes up this short ball outside off and dismisses it to the midwicket fence. Half-tracker and duly pulled away
proper bouncer, flies through to the keeper, as he ducks under it. Too high, and called a wide
back of a length and skids back in at 137ks, think Markram inside-edged it onto his pad
good length and on off stump, can't breach Amla's defences (yet)
Amla shuffles across off and keeps out a full incoming ball on middle
pitched up and outside off, smoothly pushed to short cover off the front foot
full and angling in at off, defended back down the pitch
shorter and on off, dropped into the covers
full on off, dropped into the covers once again
full and just a shade outside off, Markram stretches out and pushes it back to the bowler
fuller and outside off, tipped in the gap at the covers
Amla shelves the booming cover drive and lets this full ball go outside off
on a length and outside off, Amla takes it on the up and scythes it to the covers
full on off, driven up to mid-off
on a length and outside off, regal cover drive from Amla. He drives it with the wrists through extra-cover. So easy on the eye. Amla at his best. One can't say the same about the Pakistan attack
on a length and holds its line outside off, Markram goes after it and edges the ball down to gully
edged again, but past the reach of Babar diving to his right from gully. On a length and wide outside off, stabbed away in the air and Markram gets away with it
back of a length and outside off, Markram goes after it, again, and punches to point
fuller and angling into off, Markram shuffles forward and across and defends it away to the leg side
good length on off, played back to the bowler
fuller and on off, dropped to the covers
big appeal from the bowler. Not too much support. Skiddy length ball catches Amla on the flap in front of middle. Probably going above
shot. Good balance there. Short of a length just outside off, gets on top of that and punches handsomely through cover. That's fifty for the partnership, in just under 13 overs
bouncer dug in too short. Ducks under that and it goes down leg
oh well bowled. Serious pace there. Length ball slammed in outside off and Markram looks to drive on the rise with a big gap between bat and pad. Beaten on the inside edge
length on middle stump, nudged to mid-on's right with soft hands. Fielder too deep to stop the single
length and just outside off, left alone
length ball just outside off, defended into the covers off the front foot
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
rapped on the back thigh and the sole lbw appeal is turned down. Defended inside the line as he went on the back foot
length and just outside off, defended with a half stride
short of a length and rising in the corridor. Left alone
skids onto the bat as he withdraws late. Length ball wide outside off. Leans in and changes his mind late. Deflected into the gully region
length at leg stump, tickled down to fine leg
length at middle and leg, dragged to deep square leg
full face. Overpitched at middle stump. Stands tall and punches it past Markram
short of a length just outside off, gets on his toes and punches to point. Got right behind the line of that
bouncer at middle stump, ducks under it
glorious! Short of a length just outside off. Gets behind the line but not quite into it with stride. Uses a short-arm pull to chip this to the midwicket boundary
outside edge but soft hands from Amla. Length ball just outside off, straightens on him. Past gully
length ball just outside off, defended off the back foot
full and in at middle stump, defended solidly down the pitch
outside edge falls short of third slip. Shadab dives forward but that's well short. Another length ball straightening and getting big on Amla as he jabs at it. Thick edge
length and in at off stump. Defended into the leg side
length ball just outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
full and wide outside off, chases with a square drive, can't beat the infield square on the off side
length on leg stump, clipped to square leg on the up
short of a length at off stump, on the back foot to punch into the leg side
length and just outside off, defended down the pitch
length on off stump, defended to midwicket off the inside half
thick inside edge to fine leg. Length at middle stump, pushes with hard hands at this
length ball just outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, punched down the pitch off the back foot
length just outside off, leans in nicely and punches on the rise to mid-off's left. A top-drawer Makram drive to bring up his fifth Test fifty
length at off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
short of a length and in at middle stump, tapped to mid-on's right off the back foot
length ball just outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
length ball just outside off, punched off the toe-end to mid-off's left
length and wide outside off, left alone
length at off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
length ball just outside off, defended on the back foot
length on leg stump, closes the face and clips this to deep square
short of a length on leg stump, gets on top of it and clips it through the empty square leg region. Big scream from Amir. Frustrated with that line
length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, tapped to point's right off the back foot
length ball rising up in the channel. Left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended into the covers off the back foot
length ball just outside off, defended on the front foot
length ball just outside off, leans in and jabs it to mid-off's left
short of a length just outside off, left alone
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length and just outside off. Defended off the back foot
oh yes. Jaan-e-mann. Sublime from Markram. Overpitched just outside off and he oozes balance as he leans in and drills this drive wide of mid-off. High elbow, perfect stride
length on off stump, defended into the covers
length on middle stump, tapped to mid-on's right
short ball at the hips, digs it into the turf on the leg side as it gets big on him
short of a length just outside off. Defended from deep in the crease
length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot

misfield. Bad bounce for point and that trickles into the boundary. Full ball just outside off. Drives late and ends up slicing it. On second look, that was just poor technique. He didn't go down at that
length on middle stump, gets on top of it nicely and whips this wide of mid-on. Has so much time on the back foot, this guy
oh well fielder. Shadab flies to his right at extra cover to save four. Overpitched outside off and a solid punch through the line from Amla
short and wide outside off, whips the bat and cuts to find point
...more like short extra not catching. Full toss lobbed up outside off. Markram drills it hard and it bursts through extra cover's hands to run into the boundary
length at off stump, defended solidly off the back foot
another full toss. Slapped out to sweeper cover
full outside off, driven to cover's right. Imam dives and won't let that pass
full outside off, dead-batted into the off side
full outside off, pushed to point with an open face
length ball just outside off, defended solidly down the pitch
length ball outside off, left alone
length at middle stump, leans in and flicks on the up to find midwicket
see ya. Length ball at middle stump, stands tall and dismisses this. On the rise past Amla at the other end. Like a subdued Kevin Pietersen, that poise
length and in at middle stump, defended to mid-on
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
full and dipping outside off. Met on the full and driven back to the bowler off the toe-end
short and just outside off, on top of the bounce to cut to backward point
length at off stump, defended into the covers
length at off stump, blocked into the covers
full outside off, whippy drive to sweeper cover
googly, coming in as he gets on the front foot and defends close to the body. Looks like he picked that
length at off stump, blocked from the crease
short of a length just outside off, shuffles and pushes it into the leg side
short of a length just outside off, left alone
length ball just outside off. Looks to drive on the rise but is through it too early. Dribbles down the pitch off the inside half
length ball just outside off, defended off the back foot
length ball just outside off, solidly blocked on the front foot
on a length and outside off, Markram stays in the crease and blocks it to the off side
good length and slanting in at middle, Markram jumps across off and deals with it. Played to the midwicket region
ooooh, what a shot! On a length and outside off, offered on the up, Markram takes it on and belts it through the covers. His cover-driving has been glorious
much fuller and straighter, driven away to mid-on's right
Amla ventures across off to keep out this good length ball tailing into middle
back of a length and holds its line outside off, ignored in the channel
good length and just a shade outside off, Markram tips forward and jabs to the covers
good length and on a fourth-stump line, played back to the bowler
Markram gets behind the line on this length ball on off and blocks it back to Abbas
shorter and slanting in at off, blotted into the leg side
on a length and outside off, whisked to mid-on off the front foot
on a length and Abbas keeps threatening off stump, Markram keeps blocking it off the middle of the bat
fuller and just a shade outside off, Amla presses forward and defends with an open face to point
back of a length and angling in at off, Amla gets behind the line and defends it back
overpitched and outside off, Amla reaches out for the ball and crunnnnnnnnches it through extra-cover. Top shot from a top batsman
Ali responds with a length ball that rears up outside off, Amla yanks his bottom hand off the bat and fends it off
on a length and outside off, belted on the up through the covers. There's no stopping this as well
full at off stump, Amla plays it back off the front foot
back of a length and just a shade outside off, defended
back of a length and on middle, worked off the back foot to midwicket
fullish and outside off, stabbed to mid-off by Markram
Abbas rolls his fingers across this 106ks offcutter, Markram reads it and keeps it out
back of a length and outside off, Markram goes for a short-arm pull over midwicket. He splices it over the leg-side infield and gets away
back of a length and outside off, jabbed into the covers
on a length and outside off, run away to backward point
back of a length and jags back in, cramps Amla for room, squeezed to the covers
fuller and outside off, Amla goes hard at a drive, hence loses his shape, and the ball rolls to mid-on
back of a length and zipping through the channel, ignored by Amla
fuller and angling in at off, defended back to the bowler
that's a delightful drive from Amla. Pitched up and outside off, he jumps across off and flays it through extra cover like a boss
lifter outside off, gets too big on Markram, he hooks and misses
back of a length and outside off, shuffles across and works to midwicket
chest-high short ball on off, swivels on the back foot and hooks it to fine leg
Amla shuffles across off and dabs this length ball from outside off to gully
bouncer on middle, Amla swerves out of the way
back of a length on off, Amla gets right behind the line in defence
wide of the crease, angling into the middle of Markram's front-foot defence
on the pads, and whipped away smoothly through midwicket. The ball fizzes away to the boundary. Loose, loose bowling from Pakistan
Markram opens the face and runs this full ball from outside off to point

Lucky break for Pakistan. They've snaffled Markram down the leg side for 90. Another loose ball, straying down the leg side, all it needed was a tickle. Markram can't get enough bat onto it and deflects it away to Sarfraz diving away to his left and catching the ball. Ultra Edge detects a spike and Markram walks back 10 short of a ton
on a length and outside off, de Bryun gets forward and blocks to cover
shuffles across off and whips a full ball from middle to midwicket
back of a length on middle, Amla gets inside the line and glances the ball away to fine leg
on a length, angling in towards off, and straightening away late past the outside edge. Top ball from Abbas
on a length and outside off, de Bruyn lets the ball slide off the bat-face to point

De Bryun pads up to an incoming delivery from Abbas. So, impact doesn't matter. Not given by umpire Ravi. Full, starts outside off and curves in, grazes the back thigh. Probably bouncing over the stumps
De Bruyn presses forward and glides it from outside off to point
full and outside off, tipped to cover-point region
wide of the crease, full and holds its line outside off, driven back to the bowler
jabbed away to the left of short midwicket
good length and holds its line outside off, no shot
on a length and around off, jabbed back to Ashraf off the front foot
short and outside off, gets behind the line and taps back past the bowler
Amla takes a short ball from outside off and flashes it on the bounce to gully
full and wobbling away outside off, left alone in the channel
belting straight drive from de Bruyn. Slightly overpitched and outside off, drilled away past the bowler, straight of mid-off
on a length and outside off, run away to point
full and attacking the stumps, patted to mid-on
good length on a fourth-stump line, defended off the front foot, head over ball
De Bruyn presses forward and dabs a full ball to cover
back of a length and angling into, defended back
back of a length and outside off, Amla belatedly steers it away between slips and gully for four
on a length and outside off, blocked off the front foot
back of a length on middle, jabbed to mid-on
fuller and outside off, bounces through to the keeper, left alone
hip-high short ball on off, Amla camps on the back foot, swatting it away to fine leg
short at the body, fended off
pitched up and angling across off, no shot
pitched up and angling away outside off, left alone
punched on the up but Amla can't get it past short cover
back of a length and slanting away outside off, ignored
overpitched and outside off, thrashed straight to short cover once again
floated too full and outside off, de Bruyn lays into it and unfurls a gorgeous cover-drive. Faheem's foot is on the line. Touch and go. Called a no-ball in the end
back of a length and just a shade outside off, played back
mighty full and outside off, jammed back to the bowler
full and wobbles away outside off, no shot
full and hung up outside off, the batsman does not bite
short and angling in at off, de Bruyn gets behind the line and fends it back
very, very wristy! Overpitched and outside off, the batsman leans into it and cracks it through the covers. He's looking good out there
short and angling away outside off, guided to cover
back of a length and outside off, blocked to cover
back of a length and angling across off, left alone by de Bruyn
back of a length and outside off, patted down the ground
De Bruyn looks away, ducks into a short ball and cops a blow. He doesn't flinch. Dug in short, and angling away, hits the shoulder and goes to the cordon
back of a length and outside off, blotted to the covers, and that's drinks
full at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
length ball at off, ripping and jumping away. Left alone

got him! Amla left the last ball and that's what he should have done with this one too. Similar line and length, just outside off, short of a length length. Jumping up. He gets leg side of it and looks to punch it this time. There wasn't enough room and it flew off the outside edge. Slip leaps two-handed, high to his right, and holds on
full and just outside off, driven with the turn to cover
googly at a length on leg stump, gets his thigh guard as he looks to waft at it
length ball just outside off, defended to gully off the outside half

lbw appeal is turned down. That looked close! Pakistan have reviewed this. Length ball at middle and he's shuffled a long way to try and flick this. Caught right in front of middle. Around the knee roll. Did it pitch in line? Appeared that way...no edge on it. Leg stump visible as he's struck...ah but this has pitched outside leg stump. Review lost.
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length ball shaping away from off stump. Bit of reverse? He shuffles and closes his face on it, gets a leading edge to float between non-striker and mid-off
length in the corridor, left alone
length ball pushed across off stump, left alone
length ball just outside off, tapped into the covers
beaten. More turn and bounce for Shadab. Just outside off, draws him forward and rips it past the outside edge
length ball just outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
length on off stump, dead-batted into the pitch
googly at a length, wide outside off. Picks it. Leaves it
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length ball just outside off. Gets behind the line and drops it into the covers with soft hands to steal his first run in Tests
length at off stump, shuffles and tickles to mid-on's right
short and rising up in the corridor. Gets on top of it and defends into the turf
thick edge through to the backward point boundary. Length ball outside off. Gets forward and pushes at it, a touch away from the body. It dribbles past gully
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and in at leg stump. Gets on top, allows it to come on and uses the angle to clip it through midwicket off the back foot
length ball just outside off, defended into the pitch
googly at a length outside off, defended into the pitch
smokes it into the stands! 'Ohhhhhhh!' goes the crowd. Shadab drops this very short and it's turning away slightly, but Hamza in perfect position to clatter this with a pull over the midwicket region

just past slip. Dangerous shot! Shadab is getting it to climb dangerously in the corridor, so the cut is not advisable. This one isn't turning to much. Might even be coming in at Hamza as he shapes to cut. It's up to chest height in the end and he just manages to dab this to the slip's right
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, nicely to the pitch after stepping out. Clips to mid-on's right
length and in at leg stump. Gets on top of the bounce and tickles it through square leg
length ball in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
full and in at off stump, defended down the pitch
bouncer gets up at him sharply. Off stump line. Jumps under it to let it go
short of a length and in at off stump. Defended towards gully
whack. Very short, just enough room outside off for an easy pull. De Bruyn makes sure to watch it and place it wide of mid-on
lobbed up at a length outside off, poked to extra cover off the front foot
loopy full ball outside off. Gets him to go across the line and he just manages to get an inside edge on this
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, cut to cover

risky but a good shot in the end. That's a tad short and seemingly there for another easy pull. But it's a slider from Shadab and it doesn't rise too much either. Headed straight for middle stump and he's deep in the crease. Manages to get it to the square leg boundary in the end, with great timing

shot! Often a good indicator of technique is how well someone plays the hook. Hamza plays it near-perfect against this ball. Short and up at middle stump. Head very still, feet deep in the crease and he watches it closely as he slaps this along the floor to deep square's left. Swivels right at the end to get it where he wants
length ball just outside off, left alone. Dies on the keeper
short of a length outside off, left alone
length and in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
short and up at the right shoulder. Leaps up and defends into the leg side

appeal for catch behind is turned down. Tell you what, there's a sound on this. Bouncer going down leg. Comes up slow off the surface. Hamza looks to hook and is through it early. It climbs over the bat...and replays show there was no edge or glove on it
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up outside off, driven to cover's right. Big dive to save three
length on off stump, pushed into the covers
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
length outside off, dead-batted into the pitch
short and just outside off. Chopped off the under-edge to point
length and just outside off, shuffles and flicks to mid-on
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
short of a length just outside off. Flicked to mid-on's right off the back foot

adjusts and slaps it aerially over cover. Short ball outside off. Looks like he thinks of leaving that for a millisecond. But it's come off slowly from the surface again and he has time to jump and swish under this. Full control by the end of it
short of a length just outside off, defended into the covers
another short one from Shadab. Sliding on outside off. De Bruyn on top of it as he chops it late
length outside off, defended into the pitch
full and looks like a googly. He's right by the pitch of it to dead-bat into the turf
length ball turning away on off stump, defended off the front foot
short and turning away just outside off. Under-edge on the cut
yorker length at off stump, jammed to cover's left off the front foot
...three after this. Short ball just outside off. No movement, no extra bounce. De Bruyn with more scything. Past backward point
short of a length just outside off, left alone
to point's right now. Short of a length with no trouble again. Punches off the back foot this time. Shadab gives chase from covers and puts in a slide, can't pull it back
length ball just outside off, defends in front of mid-on with soft hands
full and just outside off, driven to mid-on
length and just outside off. Blocked on the front foot
short and rising up outside off. Short-arm pull to mid-on's right. Sarfraz thinks that's Amir's to stop at midwicket. He has a case...
short of a length just outside off, punched to extra cover
full outside off, driven to extra cover
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
tossed up outside off, left alone
full outside off, driven on the bounce to short extra
slow loopy dipper at a length outside off. Dropped into the covers off the front foot
length at off stump, makes room and punches to mid-off's right
length at leg stump, flicked to square leg
length at leg stump, flicked to square leg's left
short of a length on middle stump, tapped to the bowler off the back foot
length on leg stump, blocked on the front foo
short of a length slider outside off. Hurried pull to midwicket
tossed up outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper's left
googly not picked. Length outside off and he pokes well away from the body on the forward defence. Inside edge into the leg side
short of a length just outside off, punched into the covers
googly, short and wide outside off. Get deep in the crease and slices forcefully past slip
length at leg stump, flicked to square leg
short ball at leg stump, gets deep in the crease, caresses it to the square leg boundary
length at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length at the stumps, defended on the front foot
short and just outside off. Slides low and he dabs it expertly past slip. Trickles to a stop some five yards inside
ooh close. Full ball at off stump and de Bruyn goes very deep in the crease to play this. Just manages to stab at it to get bat
short and angling into middle, blocked carefully
Dropped by Sarfraz to his left. He was late to react and dive to his wrong side. The ball pops out in the end. Good length, seams back in, sharply, Abbas finds the inside edge, but it goes down
more seam movement for Abbas, tickled away to fine leg
fuller and holds its line outside off, de Bruyn gets forward and guides it to cover
shuffles across and works it away to midwicket

back of a length and seams back in to pin the pad, but the height seems to be an issue. Not given lbw by the umpire. Sarfraz wants a review. Abbas' front foot is fine. The ball starts outside off and shapes in to hit the front pad above the knee-roll. I think this is going to be umpire's call. Yup, the tracker returns umpires call on leg stump and de Bryun survives. Abbas looks skywards
on the pads, glanced away to fine leg
short on the hips, turned away to the right of the leg umpire
on a length and running away outside off, opens the face and guides it to point
good length and skipping away outside off, missing the outside edge
full, starts on leg stump and moves away, defended back down the pitch
full and around off, blocked to cover
full and seams in, takes the inside edge and wanders away to leg

Another appeal for lbw from Abbas. Umpire Wilson raises his finger, de Bryun knows he has been trapped in front. Nice and full, reverses in, de Bryun, having shuffled across, does not lay bat on ball and is pinned in front of middle. That's adjacent and the batsman doesn't even bother to review. Abbas finally has some success after the break
on a length, reverses in, bounces, pings Bavuma's glove even as he loosens his grip
pitched up and holds its line outside off, Bavuma springs forward and eases a cover drive
full and angling in, blocked on off stump
on the pads, picked away fine of long leg for four
short on leg stump, knocked away in front of square
pitches outside leg and moves away, catches Bavuma in a tangle and hits the pad
that's a gem from Amir. Back of a length and bursting away past the outside edge on its way to the keeper
Bavuma nearly chops on! Back of a length and cramps the batsman for room, Bavuma jabs at it but the ball rolls tantalisingly past off stump
much fuller on off, blocked back to Amir

Amir finds reverse swing, finds the outside edge, and it settles into the gloves of Sarfraz. Good length and curving away close to off stump, which means Bavuma to play at it. He wafts and sends an outside edge to the keeper, who makes no mistake this time. Pakistan are thriving with the old ball
full and outside off, plays away from the body and stabs to mid-off
back of a length and skids into off, defended off the back foot
full and reverses in, takes the inside edge and rolls to short leg
full on off, defended to cover
full and jags back in sharply, an inside edge saves the batsman
full and wide, scythed straight to short cover
back of a length and swerves back in so very late, slices de Kock into half and beats the inside edge
de Kock gets behind the line of this length ball outside off and blocks watchfully
de Kock rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and steers it behind point
shuffles across off and tickles the ball to fine leg. Amir's front foot has strayed
full and outside off, nicely driven to cover off the front foot
good length around off, defended to cover
blotted into the covers to round out the over
full on off, blocked off the front foot
short and skidding into the thigh as de Kock is cramped for room
full and outside off, de Kock stretches out and lets the ball slide off the face to point
tip and run to mid-on
back of a length and reverses in at off, jabbed off the inside half to midwicket
pitched up and outside off, driven to mid-off off the front foot
full and just a shade outside off, 135ks, played back down the pitch
short and just a shade outside off, chopped to point
short and outside off, forced to the off side
full and outside off, whisked to the midwicket region
full and angling across off, Hamza shows the full face of the bat and drives to mid-off

No fifty on debut for Hamza (at least in the first innings)! Amir has him nicking off. Good length and reverses away outside off, Hamza thinks about letting this go, he is late to pull his bat away. Ends up feathering it behind to the keeper. Lovely little debut innings, nevertheless
full and just a shade outside off, driven back at Abbas
short and outside off, chopped to backward point
on a length and outside off, blocked to the leg side off the front foot
back of a length and outside off, jabbed away to short midwicket on the back foot
on a length and nipping away outside off, forward and blocked to cover
back of a length and outside off, de Kock defends to cover once again
good length and sliding away outside off, blocked from the crease
full and outside off, scooped to mid-off
prodded to cover
full and straight, worked away to the midwicket region
picked off the pads to the left of square leg
de Kock leans back and slaps this short ball to cover
back of a length and outside off, punched through the line to short cover
clipped to square leg off the back foot
short and rises outside off, no shot
left alone outside off, again
full and tails in on off, blocked to the leg side off the back foot
back of a length, bounces, and straightens away past the outside edge
short, wide, lashed away to the left of backward point
back of a length and slanting away outside off, ignored
full and straight, nurdled to the midwicket region
short of a length and slanting away outside off, no shot
pitches outside leg and strikes the pad as the batsman loses his balance on the flick
shuffles across and bunts a length ball from outside off to midwicket
full and outside off, driven away to point
on a length and outside off, left alone
jabbed back to the bowler
good length and nips away a touch outside off, left alone

Hasan Ali draws an appeal for lbw. Not given. Nice full, swerves back in, Philander plays around his front pad and falls over the flick. No inside edge and this seems to be heading down the leg? Nope, the tracker suggests it would have gone on to clatter into leg stump. Three reads and Philander has to go. This is the fourth wicket for Pakistan after tea
full and angling across off, played back to the bowler. Rounds out a wicket-maiden
on a length and angling across off, driven to mid-off
too full and on the pads, de Kock nails it through midwicket with a whirl of the wrists
shorter and outside off, whipped to midwicket off the back foot
pitched up and outside off, closes the face and drives to mid-on
full and angling across off, dabbed past mid-on
hip-high short ball outside off, de Kock rocks back and swats it away like a fly to the midwicket boundary. Bam. Right from the meat of the bat
jumps from a length, kicking and screaming past outside edge
shorter and outside off, opens the face and punches to point
on a length and outside off, jabbed away, does not carry to gully
pitched further up and running away outside off, Rabada chases it with a big drive. Plays a long way away from the body and feeds an outside edge to Sarfraz. Fifth wicket after tea.
pitched up and outside off, Steyn thrashes it through extra-cover
full and outside off, closes the face and hits it to mid-on
chest-high short ball on middle, De Kock gloves a pull behind square. And Faheem has overstepped
pitched up and outside off, squeezed to the covers
on a length and outside off, Steyn hangs back and pushes it back to the bowler
Steyn flits around in the crease and defends a full ball back to the bowler
shorter and wider, Steyn has a big whooosh at it.. and misses
back of a length and zipping through, Steyn feels for it and is beaten on the outside edge
overpitched and outside off, Steyn throws his hands at the ball and drives to mid-off
short ball climbing across the corridor. Pulls off the front foot, straight to deep midwicket
slower ball at a length just outside off, onto his pad off the inside edge as he pushes at this
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point
on his backside. Short ball outside off. Got out of the way. Ducked really early and fell over as a result
short at middle stump, defended off the back foot
in the air but safely into the square leg region. Length ball is a slower ball and Steyn is deceived completely
bouncer id down leg side, left alone

picks out deep midwicket! Seemed to have made a nice swing at this, but it appears that came off the toe-end. Short ball across off stump. Pulled straight to the fielder out there. More evidence that this is a relatively slow pitch
bouncer outside off, left alone
skids under the bat from a good length. Just outside off, looks to defend on the front foot and is beaten
bouncer dug in too short, left alone
another bouncer, rises past him and causes no trouble
catch behind appeal is turned down. Bouncer seems to have got Steyn on the elbow guard as he looks to fend it away. Sarfraz takes it down leg. Won't review
lovely slower ball. Full and dipping outside off. Draws him in and deceives him completely. Off the toe
slower ball at a length outside off, gets the front leg out of the way and looks to smoke that over midwiket. Beaten
yorker past leg stump. Steyn backing into the leg side trying to drive this. Can't make connection and it's between front pad and leg stump. Hasan Ali testing all his skills out now
bouncer at off stump, ducks under it to let  it go
length at off stump, defended from the crease
short of a length at leg stump, defended off the back foot
yorker at middle stump, jammed out to mid-on
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
taken at fine leg! Olivier takes on the bouncer and can only get a top edge down to Abbas. Off stump line, closes his eyes and swats at it, doesn't work for the best of them. Won't work for him
length ball, swinging in at leg stump. Defended into the leg side
short of a length and in at leg stump, defended off the back foot
length ball curving in at middle stump, defended on the front foot
full inswinger at middle stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length on the hips, tapped through leg side
short of a length on leg stump, whipped through square leg off the back foot
length ball wobbles at an off stump line. Defended down the pitch
length ball pushed across the corridor, left alone
full and floated up in the corridor. Goes across him and he leaves
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
bat-pad and safe. Length ball jags in off the surface and catches him with the front leg planted across off stump
full inswinger at middle stump, tapped to mid-on
short of a length at leg stump, deflected into the square leg region off the thigh guard
short of a length and curving down leg side. Can't get bat on the leg glance
length ball at off stump, solidly defended off the back foot
cuts the other way and squares him up. Imam looking to defend for the inswinger is rapped on the back thigh
145kph, length ball swinging down leg side
length ball pushed across off stump, pushed wide of mid-off on the rise
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length pushed across the corridor, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
full on the pads, tapped to mid-on's left

has he got him? No, says the umpire. Catch behind appeal. South Africa review. Sensational ball from Philander. Curves it in towards middle stump and gets it to zip away off the surface. Batsman looks to defend on the front foot....and Ultra Edge shows a murmur! His angled bat is coming down at the ball and the ball is jumping away from it. Then decides to have some of it and kisses the edge. What a delivery

another for Philander! Jumps up at Azhar in the corridor and takes a proper bit of the outside edge this time! QDK lunges to his right and takes it. Marginal shape away from Philander. Starts at off, moves into the channel. Azhar defends with an open face and is gone first ball
length ball swings down leg side, is past the flick shot
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short ball at the chest, hooks confidently, along the floor to deep square
143kph, outswinger in the channel at a good length, left alone
short of a length outswinger in the channel. Defends inside the line and is beaten
short of a length, swung away. Bit too much. Left alone
inside half but solid enough from Imam. Full and coming in from the corridor. Plants the front leg across and defends
length ball, curving in at off stump. Solidly blocked on the front foot

length ball, wobbling at a middle stump line. He goes just wide of the stumps for this ball, so that it can hold it's line or go across him after dipping inwards. Ends up driving on the rise to mid-on
length ball outside off, left alone
length at the pads, gets on top of it and flicks down to fine leg
length ball, shaping away outside off. Beaten as he follows with his hands
short of a length at leg stump, defended off the back foot
thick edge to the backward point boundary. Pushing for the one that comes in, holds its line and catches him on the move on the front foot, this length ball
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
short of a length, outswinger outside off. Left alone
full outswinger from middle stump. Watched closely and defended solidly down the pitch
short ball in the corridor, <strike>bends down to touch his toes</strike> gets under it to let it pass
length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length ball, some shape into off stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length ball outside off, left alone
full at off stump, some wobble. Defended into the leg side on the front foot
length ball swung down leg side, can't get bat on it

off the helmet and over the keeper. Short one in the corridor and once again he doesn't duck as much as he arches towards his toes. Eyes off the ball. On his feet and smiling and he's taking guard again
another bouncer, gets out of the way this time
full ball at middle stump, doesn't swing away like Steyn wanted it to. Slides down with the angle
length at middle stump, solidly defended into the leg side
short and wide outside off, left alone
length ball shaping away in the corridor, past the hanging bat inside the line
length ball just outside off, defended into the covers
length and marginal movement inwards. Defended down the pitch
length ball rising up outside off. Left alone
short of a length at off stump, shuffles and tickles it down to fine leg
beaten on the outside edge. Length ball shapes away from the corridor. Past his defence
past the outside edge again. Length ball in the corridor, jags away
length ball, slight shape in at off stump. Defended solidly off the back foot
length at middle stump, blocked on the front foot
oh well watched. Steyn pushes this one across Imam, starting from a similar line as the inswingers. He picks it, lets it go instead of playing for the movement in
length ball curving in at leg stump, flicked to deep square
full outswinger at off stump. Defended into the covers off the front foot
length ball shaping away in the corridor, past the attempted back foot defence
length ball at off stump, defended off the back foot
length at leg stump, flicked to square leg
short of a length and slanted across off stump. Left alone
length ball shaping in from off stump. Defended into the leg side
missed stumping chance down leg side. Length ball swings down leg. Imam's back leg is up as he looks to flick this and he's walked out too after losing balance. But QDK can't gather
lbw appeal turned down. Full inswinger at leg stump. Looks to flick and is trapped on the front pad. Probably going down
short ball in the corridor, left alone
length ball shaping away from middle. Solidly defended to mid-on
full outswinger in the corridor, beaten as he swishes at it on the front foot
short of a length at off stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
past the outside edge. Length ball, outswinger, forward defence, beaten.
and past the outside edge again. Length ball, moving away in the corridor. Brings down an angled bat at it and is beaten
full inswinger at middle stump, tapped to mid-on off the front foot
length at leg stump, pushed to backward square off the inside half
length at middle stump, pushes with hard hands and gets an inside edge to fine leg. Plonked the front leg across there and nearly got caught in front
runs! Abbas is done letting it pass the outside edge. Drives hard at this as it moves away from off. Thick edge dribbles wide of gully
length ball swung away, left alone
length ball just outside off, defended on the front foot
full and just outside off, defended on the front foot
full at middle and off, punched firmly to mid-on
length ball at off, defended off the back foot
length and jagging away in the corridor. Defended with the high part of the bat
beaten. Swung in at a length and then seams away as Imam gets on the front foot and looks to drive
proper outswinger this time. Starts at off, goes a long way away as he looks to defend close to the body
full and just outside off, poked into the covers off the front foot
length ball, swung away from the corridor. Left alone
length ball swung away from middle and off. Pushes in front of the body, thick outside edge through gully

dropped at gully! One of two gullies. Bavuma puts down a simple catch. Didn't have to move too much. Full outswinger just outside off. Looks to drive and it's shin height for Bavuma. Hard hands from him

would you believe it! Full inswinger at the pads and after a lot of swishing and missing and edging, Abbas brings out a classy little flick to get this to the square leg boundary. Clearly the inside half is his strong suit
length at the stumps, defended off the back foot. An expletive of frustration from the bowler...

dropped! Oh dear, South Africa. Are they in too close? Short of a length in the corridor. Defended again for the one that comes in. Steyn takes it away off the seam. The perfect set-up. Flying to Elgar's left at second slip, hip height. De Bruyn jumps across from third and it kisses his thumb on the way to Elgar who grabs at and can't hold on takes his eyes off it after the distraction and cops it on the chest
length at off stump, blocked into the covers
length at off, defended
length just outside off, defends inside the line and gets a thick outside edge past point
length at leg stump, flicked to fine leg
full outswinger at off stump. Defended to gully off the outside half
length ball at leg stump, leaps off the floor and clips it to fine leg's right
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
lbw appeal turned down. Imam looks to leave this, expecting it to go across him. But it comes in off the seam The opposite of what Steyn has been doing to him. Hits him high in front of middle stump
full and in at middle stump. Half a stride across and enough room to bring the bat down and flick with balance, wide of mid-on and into the boundary
length ball at leg stump, gingerly hangs the bat out at it and the thick edge sprints away to the fine leg boundary

143 kph, short ball in the corridor. Abbas has to jump out of trouble here. Has his gloves and bat up as he does so. Abbas smiles at him. Steyn says, 'don't f*****g smile at me. Don't smile,' as Abbas continues to smile at him
short ball in the corridor, left alone
short ball, fired down leg side this time. Abbas lets this one go as well
length ball shaping away in the corridor. Blocked on the front foot
dropped! Steyn holds his shoulder and walks back. Full outswinger, just outside off. Abbas pokes at it. It's flying to Amla at first slip. QDK dives one-handed to his right and grasses it
length ball down leg side. Swinging towards leg stump but not close enough as Abbas jumps into the off side and misses
full at middle stump, flicked to mid-on's left
short of a length outside off, left alone
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball swung away outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, stabs at it and is beaten
length at off stump, defended into the off side
short ball rising across the corridor. Mistimed pull, but that allows him the second as deep square runs in at this
short of a length at off stump. Defended off the back foot
length ball pushed across the corridor, left alone
short of a length and across off stump, left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended to gully off the back foot
length at middle stump, defended to mid-on off the front foot
full and in at leg stump. Tickles it to fine leg
nicely timed. Full indipper at leg stump. Leans in at it and flicks it in front of square leg who has to give chase and slide to pull this back. Hamza does it with some skill
length ball just outside off, left alone
length ball at leg stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
length ball in the corridor that Abbas thinks is a short ball. Looks to duck and sway. It passes him at waist height
outside edge onto back thigh and falls well short of gully. Short of a length ball squares him up in the corridor
bouncer at middle stump, dips into the leg side to let that go
length ball just outside off, defended into the covers
short and pushed across the corridor. Left alone
short of a length in the corridor. Withdraws the bat and lets it pass
short of a length in the corridor. Defended to midwicket off the back foot
falls short of deep square. Bouncer tucks him up again. Chest height and he's swiping under it. Off the sticker and well short of the incoming fielder
short of a length and dipping in at leg stump. Looks to tickle it fine, cops it on the thigh guard

dropped! And a run-out missed! What is happening here! Length ball in the corridor, defends inside the line, gets an outside edge that's dipping to QDK's left. He goes one-handed again with a big dive and can't hold on. It's parried behind the cordon and Imam is ball watching as Abbas takes off for the run. Literally, back turned to his partner, Imam. Abbas has to run back. Rabada picks up the throw that is a shy at the striker's end and chucks it at the other end. Misses. Abbas wasn't close to being in

potentially another missed run out chance. This one much closer. Short of a length at middle, clipped to deep square's right. He runs in throws at the non-striker's end where Rabada is sauntering back and is not behind the stumps
length at off stump, left alone
short of a length at off, defended on the back foot
short of a length and pushed across off stump, left alone
short and outside off, no shot

edged and somebody finally catches the ball. De Bruyn grabs it to his right at third slip and ends nightwatchman Abbas' little vigil. On a good length, angling in, and straightening away. Olivier tempts Abbas into wafting at it and nicking off
on a length and slanting in, Olivier finds extra bounce, fended off
pitched up and outside off, no shot offered

No wickets in the first hour. Then Pakistan give away two wickets in five balls. Olivier runs in hard and hits the deck harder. Banged in short and outside off, Shafiq ducks into it but hangs his bat and hands up.  He looks away and takes his eyes off the ball.lt brushes the bottom glove and carries through to de Kock. Not great technique from Shafiq, and just like that Olivier has lifted SA
cracker of a ball from Olivier. He rounds out a double-wicket maiden. 140ks, swerves back in, keeps low, and bursts through the weak defences of Babar
full on the pads, picked away through square leg
pitched up and outside off, forward and crisply driven into the covers
140ks, good length and just a shade outside off, blocked into the covers
another cracker, this one from Rabada. On a length, kicks up and straightens past the outside edge
back of a length and darted at the pads, tickled away to the leg side. Imam calls through his partner for a single

oooooh, the Wanders pitch misbehaves. Man down: Babar is down. Good length, climbs from there and nips in to the body, Babar fends at it but is surprised by the big bounce and is pinged on the ribs. He needs some attention from Pakistan's physio. Nasty ball, exploded off a length

hip-high short ball outside off, this does not rise and is quite slow off the pitch. Babar sat back waiting for it and nails a pull between midwicket and mid-on. That's how you shake off a blow on the body
and now Olivier goes past the outside edge. Good length, angling in, then cuts away sharply, missing the outside edge. Babar was opened up
Babar gets behind the line of this length delivery on off and defends it carefully
overpitched and outside off, Babar lays into a drive. He stretches out and crunches it through extra-cover. Off the middle of the bat and whistles away to the fence
shorter and outside off, Imam hops and fends it away square through the leg side
back of a length and outside off, jabbed away to the right of Bavuma at short cover. They take on Bavuma's arm for a risky little
short and ripping away outside off at 143ks, Imam swishes his bat out of the way
pitched up on off, patted back down the pitch
dipping full-toss outside off, 142ks, Imam gets forward and pushes it to mid-off
banged in short and angling away outside off, 139ks, Imam rises with it and pats it down calmly

edged but flies past the outstretched hand of gully! Back of a length and outside off, Babar reaches out for the ball away from the body and stabs at it. The outside edge flies past the left of gully as Babar gets away
short, wide, Babar keeps flaying at these, the ball bursts through the hands of Bavuma at point
back of a length and angling into the hips, tickled away fine of long leg, where Rabada gets across, slides, and stops the ball
lifter outside off, thuds into the gloves of the keeper, as Babar sways his upper body out of the way
Babar keeps back to a short ball outside off, rides the bounce, and plays it to point
good length and jags away outside off, Babar shows it respect and shoulders arms
full on middle and leg, Imam bunts the ball away to the midwicket region for one
full and shapes away outside off, ignored
short and outside off, Babar sits on the back foot and powerfully swats it away straight of mid-on
back of a length and angling into off, stays back and runs it away to point
keeps it short, the line is wider of off, Babar gets behind it and fends it back to the bowler
on a length and nibbles away outside off, Babar goes after it but it does not carry to second slip
banged in short and outside off, Imam dares to pull against the angle. He leaps but can't get on top of the ball. He can only fend it back to Olivier
short on the hips, Imam hops and tucks a single away to deep square leg
full and wobbles away outside off, Babar lets it go
good length and bends away outside off, finishes on a set of stumps outside off or even wider, no shot
bouncer on middle, Babar has his eyes locked on the ball before ducking under it
pitched up and outside off, Babar tips forward and pushes to the covers now
back of a length and swinging down leg, away from the reach of Imam's glance
pitched up and just a shade outside off, poked to midwicket off the inside half
full on middle, Imam presses forward and pushes it to mid-on
too full and drifting down the leg side, Imam simply tickles it away fine. That's enough to find the boundary
on a length and outside off, left alone
good length and wider of off, no shot again
back of a length and outside off, solidly punches up to the covers
pitched up and angling in at off stump, Babar covers up in defence
much fuller and attacking off, Babar inches forward and keeps it out
there goes Babar. Back of a length and outside off, Babar rises on top of it and punches it beautifully through extra-cover
Steyn now sprays it on the pads of Babar, he picks it from there and whips it away to the right of the leg umpire

What a riposte from Steyn. Fuller than a good length and snakes back in sharply, Babar weakly defends and inside-edges it onto the pad. It would have bounced over anyway and SA decide against a review. Okay, replays indicate no inside edge
pitched up and angling across off, Imam drives loosely and sends a thick inside edge to the leg side
The extra bounce gets the better of Imam. Kicks up from a length outside off, Imam spars it at. Takes the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat and flies to Elgar diving to his left from slip
good length and outside off, Sarfraz eases into a cover drive. Leans into it and caresses it away
back of a length and outside off, Sarfraz stands up tall, rises on top of the bounce and punches it through the covers with immense authority
on a length and outside off, blocked off the front foot
on a length and outside off, patted back down the pitch
Babar continues to attack Steyn. Short, wide outside off, Babar latches onto the extra width and smears it away behind point. Bam!
short and outside off, Babar wasn't in total control of it, I think, but still punches it away between point and gully
good length and bends away outside off, much closer to off, Babar pulls his bat out of the way

Whoa, how good was that? Steyn has a wry smile on his face. That was how good it was. Just short of a good length and outside off, Babar leans back, gets on top of it and punches it away square through point. Rifled away to the boundary
short of a length, angling in, then bending away against the angle, no shot from Babar now
good length and targetting off stump, Babar gets right behind the line in defence
length ball swung away from the corridor, left alone

edged and through Elgar's grasp at second slip! Looks like we're going to have to update that fielding piece. Length ball swinging away. Sarfraz wafts at it, wide away from his body. Elgar leaps two-handed to his right and can only get fingers on it
length outside off, defended to gully
oh nice. Full outswinger from off stump. Leans in nicely this time, gets a good stride out and caresses this wide of mid-off
length outside off, defended to backward point's left off the outside half
length ball with some shape away from off. Solidly defended on the back foot
pfft. Single. Short ball just outside off. Looks to cart this through the line, but it comes on too quickly. Chopped harmlessly towards sweeper cover
bounce. Length ball shaping away in the corridor and leaping up as Sarfraz gets forward to defend. QDK collects above his head
length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
now to deal in fives. Full ball just outside off, driven to cover's left. He slides, picks up and throws at the non-striker's. Rabada lets it through at midwicket, running in to back up
length ball shaping away at off stump, tapped on the rise to the bowler
yorker at off stump, jammed to midwicket's left
short of a length and shaping away in the corridor. Defended off the outside half on the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to point
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
oh beauty. Such a joy to watch. Length ball just outside off. All balance as he leans into this and punches to bisect bowler and mid-off
length and just outside off. Tapped to mid-on off the back foot
short and wide and staying low. Babar looks to play the cut, beaten on the under-edge
falls short of first slip. Short ball follows him as he sways backwards. Bat high, gloves high. He's looking to play the late cut. It pings off the glove and falls well short
short of third slip. Length ball, swung away in the corridor. Pushes on the front foot and gets a thick edge
full and swung slightly towards off stump. Jammed towards midwicket
full and slanted down leg side. Leans into the off side and tickles it fine
sliced past gully. Full outswinger in the channel. Opens the face and uses his wrists to squirt this through
length ball shaping away in the corridor, left alone
short of a length outside off. Gets on his toes and punches handsomely into the covers. Bavuma with a sensational dive to get his right hand on it

length outside off, nicely behind the line to punch off the front foot through cover. Extra cover gives chase and realises its quickly dribbling away from him. Puts in a slide and looks to pull it back with his right hand, but he can only parry it to his right and into the padding
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length and shaping away outside off. Sliced on the rise to backward point
length ball dipping in at leg stump, nudged to midwicket's right off the inside half
length and in at off stump. Solidly defended into the off side
short ball rising in the corridor. Arches back and looks to dab it over the slips. Beaten. That kept dipping in at him and cut out the room

pulled back at the cover boundary. Length ball swung away and an adventurous flail from Sarfraz wide outside off. It's off the toe-end and the feet are static. Backward point pulls it back in for extra cover
short and wide outside off, cut to deep backward point
full and just outside off. Mistimed drive. Rolls back to the bowler

close call at the non-striker's end but a an overthrow four at fine leg for the effort! Length ball just outside off, tapped to extra cover on the rise. He fumbles and Steyn has to clean up at mid-off as Sarfraz decides to run on the misfield. Full-length dive as this throw misses
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
drilled. Nice hands from Sarfraz. Overpitched ball just outside off. Doesn't have to move the feet too much. Brings the bat down on it and gets it past point
length ball shaping away from off. Walks at it and gets a leading edge as he closes the face on this
nicely placed. Short of a length and a lot of width outside off. Stays still and uses his wrists to beat deep point to the left
beaten. Short of a length and rising outside off. Stabs at it and is beaten
length at leg stump, flicked to square leg's right. Frenzied 'yeah yeah yeah' from Sarfraz. A calm denial from Babar
short of a length outside off. Looks to drive on the rise. Gets an under-edge pitch side on the off side
length ball curving away, wide outside off. Slashes hard and misses
length ball just outside off. Looks to drop and run. A strange call, that was well timed and headed straight to extra cover. Bit reckless here...
length ball outside off, gets on the front foot to block. Inside edge onto front pad
short of a length just outside off. Tapped to deep point's left
short ball in the corridor. Hurries him on the pull and he gets it to mid-on
deviates weirdly off the pitch. Crack? Short ball dies on impact and dips down leg side as Babar leaves. Goes over the stumps and keeps slanting down to go past the keeper

short of a length outside off, some swing away outside off. Waits on it and guides it to deep point's left. Comes back for the second and brings up his fifty! He got there nine overs after Babar, but he's gone past in a hurry. What an innings
length and wide outside off, left alone

taken at first slip! Second attempt. Amla finally gets a go at this whole slip catching thing, and he doesn't disappoint. Short of a length and shaping away. Some extra bounce. Sarfraz looks to jab it behind square with a horizontal bat. Amla gets his hand up and lays it off to take it on the second attempt
length outside off, jabs at it on the front foot and is beaten
length ball in at middle stump. Defended off the back foot
length just outside off, defended from the crease

holes out to fine leg! Some lessons still not learnt, it appears. Cuts, ramps, pulls, hooks - Olivier has been impossible to get away with those shots all day today. Not to mention the previous Tests. Hurries him and he is falling away, into the off side and backwards. Never a good sign when you're hooking. Top edge and Rabada runs in to hold on low

that is woeful. Another bouncer, in the corridor. Faheem is looking to pump him through midwicket with a pull, first ball. It slams the sticker of the bat and lobs harmlessly to short leg's right. Easy catch, taken without fuss
short and a tad too wide outside off. Left alone. Disappointed with himself, the bowler
mean! Bouncer at a middle stump line. Amir down quickly to let that fly
short and wide outside off. Looks to slash it over point, beaten by the bounce
short ball lifting up in the corridor. Jumps into the leg side and fends at this. Beaten
length ball, bowled into the corridor from wide of the crease. Left alone
length at off stump, solidly defended on the back foot
that's classy. Length ball just outside off, leans in with a nice positive stride and punches on the rise through cover
bouncer in the corridor, left alone. QDK leaps one-handed to receive that
length at off stump, defended to gully off the outside half
short and wide outside off. Swishes under it and is beaten
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short ball wide outside off, left alone
short ball rising up above off stump. Drops the gloves and lets it pass
attempted inswinging yorker. Dips in at leg stump and Amir hurriedly brings the bat down to tap this past mid-on
sliced aerially and to the cover boundary. Another full outside off. Keeps the feet in the leg side and slashes at this. It's off the low part of the bat, but it's effective
bouncer rises above the helmet, left alone
length at off stump. Drops it in the off side with soft hands and is sent back as Bavuma swoops down at it and throws. Overthrow at fine leg as a result
length outside off, punched on the up to mid-off
length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
bouncer, down leg side. Left alone
bouncer too short.. QDK jumps up and can only parry it to third man as Amir ducks this
short at off stump, defended solidly on the back foot
length ball outside off, slices on the rise through extra cover
short and wide outside off, under-edge on the cut

straight to short leg. Five-for number three in the series for Olivier! Short ball at the ribs. He gets up to try and defend it. Dabs it straight to the fielder. Simple. Couldn't get that down, it was too quick
back of a length on off, gingerly defended
short on off, Hasan stays leg-side of the ball and keeps it out
short and aiming at the chest, 144ks, rushes the batsman into a hook. He fends it in the air but over short leg
bouncer, fizzes through to the keeper, as Shadab swerves inside the line. The pressure is relentless from SA
short and shoved down the leg side, away from the reach of the pull
good length and homing in at off, 141ks, Shadab gets right forward and blocks to cover
Rabada wraps up Pakistan for 185. Back of a length and outside off, Shadab chases after it. He jabs hard at it and hands a catch to de Bruyn at gully
back of a length and outside off, not much movement either way, left alone
just short of a good length and outside off, Elgar ignores it again
short and angling in just a shade outside off, no shot again
on a length and holds its line outside off, 132ks, Elgar prods at it, this does not bounce at all, he bottom-edges it and threads the cordon
shorter and outside off, 135ks, Elgar goes on the back foot and rides it out to gully
full and homing in from outside off, but does not threaten off, so Elgar simply ushers it through to keeper
good length and swings away outside off, 122ks, left alone
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Markram sizes it up and laces it through extra-cover. Thrashed away through the off side
shorter and wobbles away outside off, Markram jabs away from the body and misses
very full and swinging down the leg side, well away from the reach of a diving Sarfraz
short on off, but it keeps low, short-armed away through midwicket off the back foot. Variable bounce
fuller and in the channel, Markram feels for the ball and edges it away past the cordon
short and holds its line outside off, Elgar lets it go
back of a length and swings back in, tucked off the pads to long leg
good length and nibbling away outside off, draws Markram into a lazy poke and beats the outside edge
Markram rises on top of a short ball outside off and delectably punches it between covers and mid-off
pitched up and outside off, comes back in late after passing off stump, Elgar shoulders arms
full and hung up outside off, Elgar does not bite
full and Abbas plugs away outside off, Markram ignores it

full and Abbas brings this one back into Markram, and draws an appeal for lbw. Not given by umpire Ravi. Impact seems outside off, but Sarfraz challenges the on-field not-out decision. Nips back in a bit and strikes the front pad, then ricochets onto the back pad. Was there an inside edge there? Ultra Edge detects a spike. Yup, an inside edge, and the on-field decision is upheld
short and on a fourth-stump line, Markram gets right behind the line and fends it back to the bowler
delightful back-foot punch from Markram. Rises on top of a short ball outside off and lets his hands flow through the line. Top shot
pitched up and holds its line outside off, Markram simply ushers it through to the keeper
full and swerves in at off, Markram closes the face and whisks the ball to mid-on

Amir pitches it full and gets this to swing back into Elgar. Elgar is caught on the crease, the ball moves in to graze the back leg and carry through to Sarfraz, The Pakistan captain wants a review. He thinks Elgar has nicked this and Ultra Edge detects a spike. He has tickled it behind off the back pad to the keeper. Inside edge. Fine review from Pakistan, but SA's lead has already passed 100
good length and swings back into Amla, who stretches out and smothers it
shorter at the body, Amir has Amla hopping and fending off to leg side
fuller and pushed across off stump, Amla gets forward and dead-bats it
picked away off the hips to long leg
back of a length and swings in to cramp Markram for room. He keeps it out
Amla jumps across off and defends a full ball angling into middle
pitched up and outside off, no shot
pitched up and attacking the stumps, blocked back down the pitch
pitched up and angling in at off, defended back to the bowler
full and nips back in, Amla deploys a big stride and catches the thigh pad. Impact outside the line
Amla jumps across off and defends a full ball slanting into off and middle
back of a length on middle, fended back off the back foot
good length and angling across off, tapped defensively to cover
this is full and defends straight to short cover
short and ducks back in, defended back
full and slanting away outside off, run away to point off the front foot
full and nipping away outside off, ignored
short and angling into middle, played back to Hasan off the back foot
pitched up and outside off, ignored
on a length and outside off, glides to point off the front foot
what a ball from Hasan! Fullish, angling in towards off, Amla plays for the angle but the ball seams away past the outside edge after opening up Amla
pitched up and just a shade outside off, defended back to the bowler
short and outside off, left alone and that's tea
shottttttttt. Full on middle stump, half a stride into it and a late flick of the wrists to get this wide of mid-on
length outside off, pushed back down the pitch off the back foot
length and just outside off, defended into the covers

good catch! Sarfraz leaps to his right and grabs it one-handed. That wasn't carrying to slip, he needed to get there. Length ball shapes away late and Markram chases with his hands, away from his body. Dipping on Sarfraz but he hangs on
length ball slanted in at middle stump, leaves him off the surface. Defended into the off side
full at off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
length ball skidding into the pad as he looks to flick off the back foot. Deflected towards fine leg off the thigh guard
length at off stump, pushed down the pitch from the crease
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
short ball at a leg stump line. Drops the shoulders and allows it to go. Or he tries, anyway. Looks like that's got a bit of his shoulder on the way to Sarfraz
short of a length just outside off, mistimed punch through cover off the back foot
length and in at off stump. Defended solidly off the back foot
jumps away. Short of a length in the corridor, flies well wide of the outside edge. Looks like that hit the crack
length ball just outside off, shuffles and lets go
bouncer down leg side. Chases it and can't get bat on it
length ball shaping away in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
length ball swung away outside off, left alone
full at middle stump, jammed to mid-on's right off the low part of the bat
length ball just outside off, defended off the back foot
length at off stump, defended from deep in the crease
length at middle stump, tapped to midwicket's left
slaps through the line and doesn't even bother keeping it down. Length ball dipping away towards the shine and he gets his hands out and slaps
full and in at middle stump, defended on the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
oh nice! Length ball just outside off, solidly behind the line as he sets up for this. Gets his arms through the line and punches wide of mid-off
length just outside off, tapped to mid-off's left on the up
length and just outside off. Leans in and flicks to midwicket
full and just outside off. Driven to extra cover
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on it
length ball just outside off. Hangs the bat out at it and is beaten on the outside edge. No feet at all
lbw appeal but he's well outside the line on the forward defence. Might have been an inside edge on it too. Seam pointed in this time from Hasan
full at middle stump, blocked down the pitch
full and in at middle stump. Stands tall and punches to mid-on

and when he finally bowls there's an lbw appeal that Sarfraz has sent up. Amla is pinned on the back foot by an incoming ball, but that looked like it was going down leg as he looked to flick. Yes it is. Pakistan are out of reviews. Not much of a discussion there before the review
just wide of point. Length and wide outside off. Chucks his hands at this even as it rises and ends up slicing it to point's left. Loose shot
short of a length and in at middle stump. Punched to mid-on off the back foot
short of a length just outside off, tapped to cover point on the up

good catch! Shafiq crouches and grabs one in front of his face at second slip. That went quick. Short of a length just outside off, swipes at it away from the body. There's not much in terms of deviation. Flies off the edge. The cordon is possibly closer than they usually are. Well held
into the mid-riff as he looks to glance. Short of a length and rising up at him. Beaten on the inside edge and he feels this sting

that's plumb! A bit of pitch misbehaviour and Hamza can't do anything about this. Short of a length ball, belted into the pitch. Keeps low as he gets on the back foot and is hit bang in front of halfway up middle stump
full and up at off stump. Solidly blocked on the front foot
past the outside edge. Whew. Some deviation. Length ball jumps away off the surface as he looks to defend on the inside edge
length at leg stump, gets on top and punches this past midwicket on the up
length ball wide outside off, left alone
strong forearms. Short of a length just outside off, gets on his toes and gets his weight into this back foot punch. It whizzes past cover
superb! Vintage Amla. Full and just outside off. Gets to the pitch of this and taps it wide of mid-off

Amla reviews an lbw decision. Looked like he got an inside edge on that. Oh yes, big time. Length ball keeps low. Gets on the back foot to try and flick. Again, the pitch acting up there. Big deviation into the batsman and hardly any bounce
length outside off, keeps low as he shuffles and lets this go
length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length in the corridor, left alone
length and just outside off. Deviates off the seam too. Tantalizing line from Faheem. Left alone by Bavuma
overpitched outside off, leans in and pokes this wide of mid-off
length ball outside off, left alone
short ball just outside off, rocks back on it and chops late to beat point to his left
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length at leg stump, tapped through square leg
length at off stump, defended to gully off the back foot
length at leg stump, deflected into the square leg region with the flick
short of a length outside off, swats it to fine leg's left off the inside edge
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
length ball in at off stump. Defended off the inside half
short and wide outside off. Lines up and gives it the whippy Amla cut. Right off the middle, between gully and point
inside edge as he looks to block on the front foot. Full and slanted in at off stump
beats mid-off's sprint! Full and in at middle stump. Plants a half-stride and punches it past Bavuma. Hasan gives chase but he won't win
length and pushed just across off stump, left alone
short of a length and just outside off. Defended on the back foot
bouncer at a leg stump line. Walks into the off side and looks to hook. Beaten
short of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep square
short and pushed across off stump. Ducks under it
short of a length just outside off, mistimed punch to cover's left
Ashraf floats it full and outside off, no shot
full at off, Bavuma hangs back, opens the face and dabs the ball to gully
full and Ashraf probes away outside off, ignored
pitched up in the channel, Bavuma leaves it once again
back of a length and jags back in, but bounces past off stump as Bavuma ignores
pitched up just a shade outside off, Ashraf makes Bavuma play this time. The batsman does so with soft hands, and dabs it gently to gully
short of a length on the hips, Amla brings his dexterous wrists into play and hits it to deep square leg off the back foot
full and skipping away outside off, Bavuma drives weakly and slices it in front of square on the off side
pitched up and outside off, Amla dangles his bat out, the ball rolls down to gully off the outside edge
back of a length and zips back in on middle, Amla keeps it out
