good length and nips back in at off, some extra bounce, Amla yanks his bottom hand off the bat and defends
Amla shows the full face of the bat and punches a length ball from outside off to short cover
short and outside off, Bavuma reaches out and jabs it away through point. He goes after it and finds the boundary
full and outside off, ignored
full and Ashraf explores the channel outside off, Bavuma doesn't
bouncer outside off, sways his upper body out of the way
banged in short and outside off, Bavuma arches back and lets it go again
good length and homing away outside off, ignored
Amla plays around his front pad and flicks this incoming delivery to midwicket
Amir gets this length ball to straighten away against the angle and beat the outside edge
full and just a shade outside off, can't breach Amla's tight defence
short and holds its line outside off, Amla goes after it and fences it to gully
Amir grunts as a delivers this full ball on off, Amla covers up in defence and plays it back down the pitch
back of a length and on middle and leg, Amla jumps across off and works it away to midwicket
pitched up and breaks away outside off, driven with the spin to sweeper cover
shorter legbreak, finishes outside off, Amla goes on the back foot and punches to short cover
shorter and skids on off, Amla camps back and whips with the wrists to short midwicket
looped up nicely outside off, Amla stretches out to smother it
straighter one on middle, Amla dead-bats it away
tossed on middle, Amla deploys a big stride and blocks back to Shadab
good length and holds its line outside off, Bavuma covers his off stump and lets it go
overpitched and outside off, Bavuma lunges into this half-volley and rifles a drive through extra-cover. There's no stopping that
good length and put outside off, no shot
back of a length and comes back into Bavuma, who sits back and inside-edges it onto the pad
back of a length and outside off, ignored
overpitched on off, drilled back to the bowler
fractionally short and breaks away outside off, Amla sits back and chops hard to the left of sweeper cover
Bavuma stretches out to this length ball on off, and sweeps it flat and hard in front of square leg, Cracking stroke
darted shorter on off, defended back to Shadab
on a length and turns away outside off, nothing doing from Bavuma
Bavuma jumps back, lets this length ball to spin away from him, then punches solidly through extra-cover
looped up on off, not much turn either way, Amla stretches out and smothers it
Bavuma jumps across off, gets inside the line of this back of a length ball on middle, and glances to long leg
good length and outside off, hint of extra bounce, fended onto the pitch
full and nibbles back in slightly, left alone. This stays low
short and outside off, punched up to mid-off
good length and angling into off, played back to the bowler
full and plugs away outside off does Abbas, ignored by Amla
floated up on middle, blocked off the front foot
tossed outside off, stabbed into the covers off the front foot

Delicious legbreak from Shadab. Lobbed up just a shade outside off, breaks away just enough to catch the outside edge and Sarfraz snaffles another catch behind the stumps. It's his eighth catch - most by him in any Test
full and turns back in, de Kock sits back and inside-edges it behind square on leg side
googly, shortish and turns back in, Amla hangs back and jabs to point
skidder just a shade outside off, chopped hastily to point to end the over
on a length and just a shade outside off, played back to the bowler off the front foot
de Kock jumps across and blocks this length ball on middle
fuller than a good length and moves away outside off, tempts de Kock into a lousy drive and goes past the outside edge
full on the stumps, de Kock stretches out, shows the full face of the bat, and drives straight of mid-on for four. Top shot
on a length and outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
fullish and outside off, nothing doing from Amla
flighted outside off, spins in, tickled away to square leg
tossed on leg stump, pushed away to the left of Shadab
tossed outside off, eased to long-on off the front foot. 100 up for SA in their second dig
drifts into Amla and then leaves him, sharp spin for Shadab, Amla is up to it, punching to point
tossed outside off, Amla lunges out and drives smoothly to deep cover
short and flat on the leg stump, de Kock sits back and forces a pull to deep midwicket
De Kock rides this short ball outside off and plays to gully
good length on off, blocked back to Abbas
back of a length on off, de Kock leans back and glides it to point
back of a length on off, forward and jabbed into the covers
shorter and wider outside off, de Kock latches onto it and cracks a cut behind point. Right up in his hitting arc
shorter and outside off, worked away behind square on the leg side
dragged down on middle and leg, de Kock skips back and mauls a pull through square leg for four
dangled up full and wide outside off, de Kock chases a drive and inside-edges it behind to leg slip
flighted on middle, driven down to long-on
pitches in line and spins in to catch the pad, de Kock weathers an lbw appeal. Turning down leg
half-tracker on leg stump, swatted off the back foot to deep midwicket
just short of a good length and angling away outside off, patted to point
stabbed into the covers for one
short on off, Amla leaps back and fends it back to the bowler
full and swings in, driven off an inside edge to long leg
on a length and just a shade outside off, played back
really full on middle and leg, whipped away between midwicket and mid-on for four
tossed outside off, driven with the spin to the left of short cover off the front foot
short and spinning into the hips, pulled to long leg
tossed on a fourth-stump line, defended back
shorter and spins away from off, jabbed to the covers
slightly overpitched and outside off, driven through the line, through extra-cover, Ashraf chases hard but the ball wins the race. Sarfraz isn't pleased
worked away off the pads fine of long leg
on a length and outside off, ignored
back of a length and just a shade outside off, patted into the covers
shorter and outside off, fended off to backward point
short of a length and outside off, Amla plays at the last moment and late-cuts it between gully and backward point
back of a length and skidding off the pitch to strike the pad, but this is heading down leg
pitched up and outside off, Amla keeps it out
full and outside off, blocked off the front foot
short and wide outside off, de Kock latches onto it and crunches a cut behind point for four
back of a length on off, defended back
on the pads, deflected away to the midwicket region
back of a length and just a shade outside off, stabbed to point
pitched up and slanting into the middle of de Kock's front-foot defence on off
length ball just outside off. Shuffles and smothers it into the pitch offthe back foot
length and in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot

big lbw appeal is turned down! Oh that looked very close. No reviews left. Length ball cuts in sharply and hits him on the flap in front of middle stump. Amla was deep in the crease. Was that going over?
length at off stump, shuffles and defends to square leg off the inside half
length at middle stump, defended to midwicket
length ball coming in at off stump. Brings an angled bat down to defend this. Rolls behind square off the inside edge
length ball pushed across off stump, left alone
beaten. Short of a length ball cutting away from middle stump. Looks to defend that but it gets too big on him
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
sliced but safe. Length ball outside off. Not quite to the pitch of this for the drive and the bat turns. But it's wide of point
length ball pushed across off stump, left alone
length ball pushed wide outside off. Chases for the drive, beaten on the outside edge
length at middle stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
full outside off, driven on the bounce to extra cover
length ball wide outside off. Angles in, jags away. Left alone
length and in at middle stump. Punched on the up to mid-on
length ball keeps low at off stump. Watchfully defended down the pitch
short of a length at off stump, gets behind the line and drops it into the leg side off the back foot
length at leg stump, shuffles and taps to midwicket
short ball slanted across the corridor, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length and just outside off. Blocked on the front foot
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right and that is fifty for the partnership
shot. Overpitched just outside off. Gets the weight into this with a short stride and punches firmly past Amla at the other end
short of a length just outside off, defended off the back foot
overpitched outside off, driven on the bounce to extra cover
edge but four. Squared up there. Length ball at off stump. Looks to defend on the back foot, slightly inside the line as it cuts away. It's between second slip and gully
short at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length at off stump. Defended into the toe off the back foot
short and just outside off. Dropped into the off side off the back foot
length ball curves down leg side. Looks to tickle it fine and it's into the fine leg boundary off the thigh guard

outside edge wide of gully, and into the third man boundary. That's fifty for Amla. His team-mates are on their feet applauding. Important knock. This is a length ball just outside off. He jabs at it away from the body and the edge flies low to gully's left
length and pushed across off stump, left alone
length and in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
bouncer. Dug in too short and down leg side. Left alone
length and in at middle stump. Pushed into the leg side with soft hands
length ball just outside off. Shuffles and blocks on the front foot
length and in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
bouncer down leg side, left alone
short of a length just outside off. Shuffles and drops it pitch side on the leg side for the single
full and just outside off, driven straight to mid-off
shot. Watched that closely as he pulled. Short of a length ball outside off. Doesn't rise too much. Amla leaps off the floor and rolls the bat over this to get it between deep square and fine leg
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
full at off stump, jagging away late. Defends and gets it off the outside edge
full outside off, leans in and taps to sweeper's right
shot! More than a tap this time. A full blooded drive, weight there, balance there, wrists there. Overpitched ball outside off, there. Sweeper picks it up a couple of yards to his right
length on middle stump, closes the face on it and taps it to mid-on's left
length and just outside off. Blocked on the front foot
full and shaping down leg. Looks to flick and it pings off the outside of his pad. Down to fine leg
length at leg stump, allows it to skid on and flicks to deeps square. Loud applause from the crowd because that shot brings him his 15th Test fifty
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper's left
beauty. Feet are moving well for QDK. Full ball outside off, gets a nice stride into it and places this beautifully to extra cover's left. High elbow
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
past the edge. Length ball jumps up outside off as he leans in to defend. That straightened after coming in
length outside off, defended into the off side. That was close to the pad as he played it
length and in at off stump. Plays very late as he defends into the off side
short ball fired down leg side. Left alone
length and in at the stump. Blocked on the front foot
length at middle stump, pushed into the midwicket region off the inside half
full at middle stump, shoveled to midwicket off the toe-end
length and in at the stumps, defended into the leg side
guides it past gully. Length ball straightens a touch in the corridor. Amla offers soft hands and opens the face late to get four more
short of a length ball slanted across off stump. Left alone as it climbs up
good yorker. But he keeps it out. This is speared at middle stump and he digs it out to midwicket
lbw appeal turned down. Pitching outside leg. Raps him bang in front of leg stump as he looks to flick. QDK clearly thinks he's missed out on runs there
length at middle stump, jabs on the front foot and gets it to mid-on off the inside half
yorker just outside off. Brings the bat down and taps it into the leg side
shot! Nice full face on that. Full ball outside off, leans in perfectly to get to the pitch and taps it between non-striker and stumps
full outside off, driven straight to mid-off
length and in at the stumps. Blocked on the front foot
length ball cuts back in from outside off. Left alone on the front foot. Narrowly past off stump
length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot

oh wow. Conditions don't matter to this guy, do they? It's been jagging back and away and rising from that good length outside off, but Amla trusts his hands to reach out and punch gloriously through the line to the cover boundary
length ball wide outside off, left alone

got him! This one does rise, and Amla's resistance ends. Length ball, cutting away and rising at the same time. Amla looks to defend on the front foot and it gets him on the glove. Floats to Sarfraz's right and he takes an easy catch
fuller and angling away outside off, de Kock lets it pass
De Kock closes the face and taps this length ball from outside off to mid-on
banged in short and angling away outside off, he drags a pull to deep midwicket
hip-high short ball outside off, it does not bounce as much as de Kock expects it to. Pulled weakly through midwicket region
full and holds its line outside off, Philander runs it away to gully with soft hands
pitched up and outside off, opens the face and plays to point now
short and shoved down leg, helped to long leg
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, defended off the front foot
back of a length and outside off, Philander gets behind the line and blocks to cover
pitched further up and outside off, Philander leans into a pretty cover drive, which outruns the chasing fielder. Nicely done
bouncer on middle, Philander ducks under it
on a length and bounces outside off, Philander flashes... and misses
back of a length and snakes back in sharply to pin the batsman on the back thigh. But this is surely bouncing over the stumps
full and just a shade outside off, flicked out to short midwicket
short at the body, de Kock swivels on the back foot and hooks a single to fine leg. He was in total control of it despite the ball getting big on him
short and banged down the leg side. Front-foot no-ball
bounces from a full length outside off, Philander loosens his grip and fends it off
bouncer, sails through to the keeper, as Philander lets it go
on a length and kicks past outside edge
back of a length on off, de Kock is on the back foot, clipping to deep midwicket
back of a length and angling into off, defended
full and seams back in, not too far away from off, left alone
short and ducking back in at off, Philander stands tall and punches back to the bowler
chest-high short ball outside off, Philander sizes it up and dispatches it away to the midwicket boundary. Rolls his wrists and pulls it wide of deep square leg
short on off, extra bounce, jabbed to short leg
short and angling across off, de Kock rides this 136kph delivery to deep third man
full and angling across off, squeezed to deep square leg off the inside half of the bat
hip-high short ball outside off, short-armed away to deep square leg off the back foot
full on middle, played back to the bowler
pitched up and angling across off, patted to mid-off
pitched up, nips back in against the angle from over the wicket, keeps low and chops the batsman into half
back of a length and keeps low on off, Philander stoops and defends
after the first ball keeps low, the second leaps from a length and raps the splice
edged.. and does not carry to Ali. Pitched up and wide outside off, Philander chases a drive and nicks it but it does not carry to first slip
short at the body, 140ks, pulled merrily to long leg
floated full and outside off, ignored
drifting down leg, Philander can't tickle it away
on a good length and holds its line outside off, no shot
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, de Kock props forward and blocks to cover
rides the bounce of this short one outside off and secures a single to gully
jumps from a fuller length, finishes outside off, Philander keeps it out
patted down to mid-off
back of a length and angling across off, fended off to cover
tickled off the pads to long leg
on a length and deviates off the seam. Nips in to catch the pad
full on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
short and outside off, Philander gets on top of the bounce and laces it away behind point. Lovely back-foot punch, would've done any top-order batsman proud
full at off, slapped back to Hasan off the front foot
back of a length and bursts off the deck, left alone
full and angling into the middle of de Kock's forward defence
on a length and wider of off, left alone
de Kock gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches to point
full and angling across off, attached with extra bounce, fended off
pitched up and angling across off, blocked to cover

this is vintage Amir. Top yorker from Amir, swings back in so very late. Philander hastily jabs his bat down and cops it on the front boot. This looks adjacent, but Philander chances a review. Boot first and then some bat. This is crashing into the base of middle stump. The lead, though, is 300
back of a length and angling across off, de Kock opens the face and diverts it to gully
on a length and outside off, blotted to deep point
full and wobbles away outside off, no shot
back of a length and nipping away outside off, ignored
Abbas puts it on a good length and gets it to move away past the outside edge
good length and swings back in, kept out
on a length and outside off, de Kock drives on the up to extra-cover
driven on the up but straight to mid-on
slower cutter outside off, thrashed to extra-cover, where the fielder tumbles to his left and intercepts the ball
full-toss swinging into the pads, whipped to deep midwicket
full on off, played back down the pitch to mid-on's right
back of a length on off, defended back
shorter and outside off, chopped in front of square
back of a length and angling across off, defended
full and outside off, Rabada goes after it. He chases a drive and instead slices a thick outside edge behind point
shorter and outside off, fended off
back of a length and attacking middle, played back to the bowler to round out the session
length and in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
seams away. Length ball angling in at off stump and leaving as he looks to defend
length outside off. Looks to punch with hard hands, thick inside edge to deep square
full and just outside off, tapped into the covers
length ball in at the corridor, blocked solidly on the front foot
yorker at middle stump, tapped back down the pitch
shot. Length ball at leg stump, leans in and whips this on the up. Mid-on has no chance to his left
short of a length and just outside off. Late gets past gully, who gets a hand on it and takes two runs off it
stop that! Length ball wide outside off. No hesitation as he opens his stance, plants the front leg out and slaps this through cover
length ball wide outside off, driven flat-batted to point
adjusts and gets it wide of mid-off. It's a slower ball and QDK waits an extra moment before leaning into this and caressing it past the fielder
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and in at middle stump. Tapped to mid-on off the back foot
short of a length and dipping in at off stump. Cramps him as he shapes to punch this. Defends hurriedly into the off side
length and just outside off. Looks to drive on the up, mistimed to mid-on off the inside half
length ball at off stump, squares him up as he looks to defend. Into the point region off the outside half
length outside off, tapped to extra cover's left
length ball with late swing into the batsman. He looks to flick and falls over into the off side. LBW appeal turned down. Probably going down leg
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
dropped short outside off. Gets on the back foot and looks to pull. Too eager there, drags it to deep square's right off the toe-end. Audibly displeased...
length and just outside off. Blocked on the front foot
short ball coming into the body. Looks to pull and cops it on the thigh
short of a length outside off, wafted into the off side
length outside off, pushed into the point region on the up
length ball in at off stump. Taps on the up, into the covers
bouncer at chest height. Pulled uppishly to deep square's right
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, driven firmly past the bowler
bouncer down leg side, left alone
length ball wide outside off, under-edge on the attempted square drive. Trickles into the covers
length ball pushed across stump. Pushed on the up to extra cover
length ball wide outside off, under-edge again as he looks to chop through cover on the up
gets it off the middle this time. Length ball across off stump. Half-stride and a horizontal bat to get this to the point boundary

length ball pushed across off stump. Walks down at it and flicks it wide of mid-on. Wants a second but smartly decides it isn't there. Might have heard his team-mates from the dressing room say that as well
short of a length outside off, punches at it and is beaten by bounce
low full toss on off stump, punched past the bowler to mid-on

get out of the way KG! QDK the only man who isn't laughing right now. Length ball at off stump, punched firmly to mid-off's left. Or so he thinks. Rabada lifts his right leg up really late and it deflects to mid-on. QDK has to run halfway back
length at off stump, looks to push and run on the off side. He's hit it too well

direct hit at the striker's end. But QDK in. Length ball just outside off. Tapped down the pitch. Rabada lets it pass this time and takes off for the run. QDK says no as mid-off swoops down on it and throws
length outside off, punched firmly on the up but extra cover dives to stop to his left

'yeahhhhhhhh,' he screams and it's not a call for a run. It's QDK celebrating his first Test hundred in two years! A phenomenally talented batsman who has found it a little difficult over the last 18 months in this format. Leans in and converts this full ball into a full toss. Drills it between Rabada and mid-off. Punches the air and takes off his helmet
length at middle stump. Looks to flick but this stops on him. It's a chip over mid-on in the end
short of a length outside off, beaten on the outside edge as he looks to swish at this
length and in at off stump. Blocked into the off side on the up
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
offcutter. But it skids on. Still beats the outside edge as Rabada defends early and inside the line
full and into the toes. Gets the front leg out of the way and clips it to deep square's right. Long sprint and slide from the fielder there to save the run. Good effort
short of a length at leg stump, on the back foot as he flicks to deep backward square
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length ball at middle stump, spins into the pad as he looks to flick
short of a length at leg stump, flicked to backward square
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
googly, full and flat at leg stump. Driven to long-on
short of a length at leg stump, whipped to fine leg's right off the back foot
short of a length across off stump. Flicked to deep square off the back foot
short and climbing across off stump. Left alone
short and slanted across off stump. Swishes at it and is beaten
length ball, across off, beaten on the push
shot. Full and just outside off. Driven with the angle to extra cover
full and down leg side. Thinks of the sweep, thinks of the flick, thinks of the flick. Doesn't make connection with the hybrid waft
full on off stump, driven to mid-off

he's been given lbw and reviews it. Length ball pitches outside off and spins back past the inside edge to hit him in front of middle as he looks to defend. Big turn on that. No bat on it...and missing leg stump! Wow, what a call that is from the batsmen. Big turn on that.
length on middle stump, defended past short leg on the front foot
length at leg stump, looks to flick and misses
full at off stump, driven down the pitch

dropped. Sarfraz can't hang on high to his left. Length ball pushed across off stump. Looks to whip it into the leg side. Closed face, leading edge. Tough to spot those when they come off the leading edge. He's late to react to it and gets only one hand on it
full outside off, driven to deep cover
crunch. Overpitched and wide outside off. Gets the front leg out and spanks it wide of mid-off
well bowled. Full slower ball just outside off. De Kock withdraws after shaping to drive this
short of a length and just outside off. Looks to turn it into the leg side and gets an inside edge, pitch side. Another slower ball that
length at leg stump, defended aerially into the leg side
full on middle stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket's left
length at middle stump. Blocks on the front, cops it on the pad
full and dipping at leg stump. Looks to whip into the leg side, cops another one on the pad
length at middle stump, gets forward and gets another one off the pad. Lobs to leg gully
there it is. Googly, but too short to bother him. Gets on the back foot and defends into the off side
length at off stump, defended off the back foot

pumped! Oh Hasan is not enjoying this, more so after the dropped. This is a slap to the ego from QDK - gets the front leg out of the way, meets the full ball outside off and launches it over the bowler
slower ball, at a length on off stump. Blocked into the off side
into the leg side this time! Full and slanted in at the stumps. Once again, foot is well out of the way, allowing for a clean swing with the angle. Picked up, wide of mid-on
short and wide outside off, cut to deep backward point
length ball wide outside off, slashes and misses
length ball wide of off stump. Beaten as he looks to defend
full on off stump, defended to midwicket with the turn
short of a length at leg stump, tapped to deep square's left off the back foot
oh lovely. Length ball outside off, doesn't get to the pitch but leans in and drives firmly on the up. Beats mid-off's dive to the left
length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
googly, full at middle stump. Closes the face early. Leading edge to mid-off
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
short and outside off, Rabada hops and gets an inside-edge onto the thigh pad
back of a length and slanting away outside off, Rabada swishes and connects with thin air
on a length and angling across off, Rabada feels for the ball and outside-edges it away, threading the cordon for a four
short and rises outside off, Rabada flashes and misses once again
back of a length on the stumps, Rabada hangs back and fends it away to the leg side
similar length but this moves away from Rabada with the angle. He goes after it and gets beaten on the outside edge
looped up on middle, de Kock drops one to one knee and smokes a slog-sweep into the grass banks over midwicket. Boom. Launches SA past 300

De Kock holes out to Hasan Ali at deep square leg. Dragged down on leg or even outside, de Kock eyes up a pull but hits it straight to the man in the deep. He raises his bat and walks off for a punchy 129. Steyn pats him on the back as he walks out to bat
tossed up on middle, and breaks away, catches the edge but does not carry to slips
full and spins away outside off, running past the outside edge
Steyn plays inside the line of another legbreak and is beaten on the outside edge once again
flatter and quicker on off, defended back to the bowler
short of a length and slanting away outside off, a flat-footed waft from Rabada but he can't touch the ball

Faheem has bounced out Rabada. But guess what Rabada has more runs in this series than Azhar Ali. Short and angling away outside off, he can't get on top of the ball. Rabada pulls weakly and splices it to extra-cover
Faheem goes wide of the crease, and angles a bouncer at his head, he ducks under it
short on leg from round the wicket, the batsman ducks under it
another lifter, Olivier rocks his head out of the way
yorker outside off, jammed to the cordon
starts outside off, and breaks away, left alone
pushed through on off, driven with the turn via an open face to point

Shadab has No.11 Olivier nicking off with a biting legbreak. On a length, starts just a shade outside off, and turns away. Shadab finds the edge and Sarfraz pockets his 10th catch of the match - the Pakistan record for most dismissals in a Test match
good length and slanting away outside off, ignored by Imam
back of a length and swings in a bit, tip and run to cover. Imam gets off the mark
full and outside off, Masood shelves the drive and leaves
fuller and finishes wider of off, ignored again
full and outside off, no shot
Steyn sprays one on the pads, picked off to deep square leg
pitched up and holds its line outside off, left alone
on a length and outside off, run away behind point
back of a length and outside off, fiddled to the covers off the back foot
full and outside off, ignored
left alone outside off again
full and swinging into the pads, Masood leans into it and elegantly flicks between midwicket and mid-on
back of a length and just outside off, defended back
on a length and outside off, tip and run to point
chest-high short ball on middle, Masood skips back and pulls over midwicket
fuller and angling across off, left alone
full and finishes on or wider than a set of stumps outside off, left alone
pitched up and outside off, Masood drives it right past the bowler
back of a length and angling away outside off, left alone
back of a length on middle, forward and blocked to cover
on a length and around off, driven to mid-off off the front foot
sublime on-drive from Imam. Full and on off, Imam stretches out, shows the full face of the ball and eases it straight of mid-on
good length and outside off, no shot
full and running away outside off, Imam prods it past the cordon. Does so with soft hands
Masood gets behind the line of this short ball outside off and blocks to cover
squirted through point off an outside edge
back of a length and angling across off, left alone
back of a length and seaming away outside off, the batsman is squared up as he squeezes a single in front of square on off side
short at the body, hops and tucks it to the leg side for one
good length and slanting away outside off, left alone
fuller on and around off, defended off the front foot
this is not a half-volley outside off, Imam leans into it and sweetly drives it away to the left of short cover
full on middle, defended off the front foot
diverted off the pads to long leg
shorter and outside off, jabbed down the pitch off the back foot
Masood jumps back to defend this short ball outside off
on a length on leg stump, Imam looks to work it away through midwicket. Instead, leading-edges it onto the pitch
short and angling across off, keeps low, kept out
Imam arches back and lets this short ball fizz through to the keeper outside off
Imam gets on top of a short ball outside off, chops it hard into the ground, and finds the gap at point
dug in short and takes off the pitch. 142ks, rushes Imam into a hook and sails through to de Kock, who collects it over his head
short, wide, 144ks, left alone
full on off stump, defended into the leg side
length ball just outside off, gets behind the line and punches it wide of mid-off
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg's right
short of a length at leg stump, defended into the leg side with soft hands
nicely timed. Short and wide outside off, reaches out and punches it to mid-off's right. Philander gives chase and pulls it back in with a slide
length ball pushed across the corridor, left alone
length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length ball just outside off. Defended into the covers off the front foot
beats the inside edge. Short of a length and pushed across him. Looks to pull but is beaten by pace
length at leg stump, pushed into the leg side with soft hands
good bouncer, well left. Rises up at an off stump line, throat height. Drops the gloves and arches into the leg side
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball pushed across off stump, left alone
short and wide outside off, left alone

on the floor! That does a bit off the surface. Short ball in the corridor. He is set to leave it but it comes back into him after pitching. Has to get his chest out of the way and falls down as he does so
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length ball pushed across the corridor, left alone
on the box. Olivier gets a short of a length ball to lift up at Masood's mid-riff as he looks to pull
short of a length at leg stump, whipped to fine leg
length at leg stump. Gets deep in the crease and nudges this through midwicket. Good confident calling
short ball in the corridor, chopped to gully with an angled bat
short ball down leg side. Looks to dab this fine. Gets a glove to QDK's right
short and just outside off. Under-edge to mid-off as he looks to cut
short of a length and pushed across off stump, left alone
length at middle stump, tapped to mid-on's left
length ball just outside off, defended into the off side
chopped away. Short and slanted across him. Watches it closely and gets it right off the middle. That's fifty for the opening stand
short of a length at off stump. Cramped as he shapes to punch into the covers. Forced to drop it into the pitch
short of a length across the corridor, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length and in at off stump. Blocked on the front foot
full outside off, leans in slices it past point. Not well timed but it runs away from Bavuma who slides and flicks it back, but the momentum takes it into the padding
short of a length and angled into the corridor. Left alone
full and in at off stump, driven to mid-off
short of a length at off stump. Gets deep in the crease and flicks into the vacant midwicket region
length and just outside off. Defended off the back foot
length at off stump, poked through cover off the outside half
bouncer down leg side, left alone
short of a length outside off, defended into the covers
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short of a length in the corridor. Defended to point off the back foot
length and in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length and in at off stump, defended to cover off the back foot
length and wide outside off, sliced to deep backward point
full and just outside off. Leans in and pushes it wide of mid-off
short of a length and in at leg stump. Flicked to deep square
bouncer across the corridor, left alone
length ball just outside off. Left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length and across off stump, left alone
length ball just outside off, defended down the pitch
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right off the front foot
short of a length outside off, left alone
length at leg stump, flicked to square leg off the back foot
edge doesn't carry. Length ball outside off. Looks to drive away from the body. It falls short of Elgar who signals that it did
length ball pushed across off stump, left alone
edge and this one is short of gully. And a fair bit wide to his right. Some late swing from Philander. Away from the batsman who is looking to defend this length ball outside off
length outside off, defended off the inside half
full and down leg side, can't get bat on that
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square leg
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
length across the corridor, blocked on the front foot
nicely controlled. Short ball down leg side. Hooks into the turf and gets it down to fine leg
short of a length outside off, defended into the covers
short of a length at leg stump, whipped to deep square's right off the back foot
past the outside edge. Vile from Philander again. Gets this to jump away sharply after pitching at off stump. Masood is beaten on the defence
length and just outside off, blocked into the covers
short of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
full and just outside off. Pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
length ball pushed across off stump, left alone
length at off stump, blocked off the back foot
length ball outside off, behind the line to defend into the covers
length and in at off stump. Shuffles and punches to mid-on on the up

got him! In, in, in. One holds the line and gets Imam to defend inside the line. This was the reason he went around the wicket. Belts it in, short of a length in the corridor. Imam looks to defend the off stump ball and gets a tiny, faint edge. Not much he can do there. Was defending quite close to the body too. Falls after another good start
short of a length and down leg side. Can't get bat on it
mean short one in the corridor. Drops the gloves and lets it go
length ball outside off, left alone
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
short and wide outside off, hangs leg side of it and opens the face late to get this cut past point. Expertly done
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off, defended to point off the front foot
length ball keeps low outside off. Defended off the back foot
short ball rising up in the corridor. Gets on top of the bounce and defends off the back foot
slower yorker. At off stump and Azhar is quickly behind to try and jam it out. Manages it
short and up in the corridor. Off the ground to drop it into the leg side
full and in at leg stump. Flicked to square leg's left
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
keeps low but he keeps it out. That was plumb if the bat didn't come down. Short of a length ball skids on and he defends at shin height

he's got him with an offcutter! Or so he thinks. Azhar reviews. It's got him on the pad, but he's been given out caught at gully. SA and the umpire think there is an inside edge on that. But it'll be checked for two dismissals...first indication from the replays is that there's no bat on it. It's hitting the flap as he defends on the front foot...and it's missing off stump. Good review. The double sound was the ball flicking the flap and then going onto thigh guard, not bat onto pad as it appeared at first
overpitched outside off, punched to mid-off on the front foot
length outside off, dead-batted into the off side on the front foot
length ball curving away outside off. Left alone
length and just outside off. Defended into the covers
short of a length and in at off stump. Chops it wide of third slip
cops it on the body. Looks like left bicep. Or just under. Short ball doesn't rise as much as he expects. Takes his eyes off it to try and let it pass down leg side
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length outside off, blocked into the covers

big appeal for catch behind. Wilson says not out. South Africa review. This short of a length ball jumps into Masood and cuts him in half. There's a sound as it passes him and sails over the stumps. QDK takes it down leg side...there is thigh guard on it. But was there an edge first? Ultra Edge awaited...a disturbance as it passes bat. Thin edge, thigh guard, and taken down leg. Decision overturned. Masood doesn't look happy about that. Big angry strides up the tunnel.
floated full at off, Azar, who's back at the crease, defends it stoutly to the leg side
this explodes from a length and surprises the keeper who is up to the stumps. Absolutely takes off, Azhar did well to leave it
Azhar shuffles across off and defends this full ball on middle to midwicket
back of a length and skidding through the channel. Left alone once again. De Kock can't make a clean collection behind the stumps
full and tinged with some inswing, Azhar jumps across off and fends it to the leg side
on a length and wobbles away outside off, Philander tempts Azhar into a lousy waft and goes past the outside edge
short on the hips, tickled away to long leg
short ball at the body, Azhar gets inside the line, rides the bounce, and guides the ball to fine leg. Well played
full and straight, flicked away square of long leg for a double
pitched up and outside off, 136ks, Shafiq covers his off stump and lets it pass
WHAT. A. BALL. Steyn! He hits a hard length outside off, angling in towards off, tricks Shafiq into playing for the incoming angle. But this straightens late past the outside edge
much fuller and largely holds its line outside off, left alone in the channel
back of a length and finishes wider than a set of stumps outside off, nothing doing from Azhar
edged but does not carry to second slip. Olivier ventures wide of the crease and gets it to seam away, the batsman jabs and gets away
rib-high short ball on off stump, he takes it on with a hook and lifts it over backward square leg, gets it to the left of Steyn at fine leg for four
back of a length and in the channel at 140ks, left alone

De Kock thinks he has his man, but umpire Ravi shoots down the caught-behind appeal. Elgar chats with de Kock and calls for a review. Olivier runs in hard and hits the deck harder. Back of a length and zipping away outside off, Olivier tempts Azhar into jabbing at it. Daylight between bat and ball. Poor review from SA and they lose it
short and outside off, Azhar arches back and lets it pass
Shafiq gets on top of a short one outside off and forces it to the covers off the back foot
another short ball outside off, Shafiq dares to take on Bavuma's arm. Drops it to the right of Bavuma at point and secures a hard-run single
full on middle and leg, patted to mid-on off the front foot
on a length and on a fourth-stump line, defended to mid-off off the front foot
top shot, Azhar. On a length on middle, punched on the up past the right of Steyn and left of mid-off. Delightful timing
back of a length and outside off, forced away to the left of backward point, where Bavuma swoops to his left to intercept the ball
Olivier bangs a bouncer outside off, 135ks, Shafiq sinks under it
short of a length and angling into the middle of Shafiq's forward defence on off
sliding into the pads from wide of the crease, deflected off the bat to the fine leg boundary
Olivier offers up a half-volley outside off, Shafiq leans into it, shows off his high elbow, and drives it languidly through extra-cover
full and slanting into a leg-side flick to short midwicket off the front foot
Shafiq leans back to this short ball outside off, 143ks, he uses the pace of Olivier to his advantage and flays a cut behind point

back of a length and snakes back in from outside off, seams away late and bursts through the defences of Shafiq. Unplayable. Bounce and movement, beats the edge. Replays, however, suggest a nick and Ultra Edge confirms it.
back of a length and on the hips, Azhar puts it away, flicking through midwicket
shorter and outside off, a back-foot force to mid-on ensues
back of a length on off, jabbed to the covers
good length and outside off, ignored
short and outside off, Azhar hops, skips, and fends a single to the leg side
short and springs off the surface, Azhar flashes and does not make contact
Azhar rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and helps it away to point
Azhar jumps to get on top of a short ball outside off. Stabbed to short cover
short and outside off, slashed on the up to point

Nasty, nasty delivery from Olivier and it puts Azhar out of his misery. Olivier roars right in the face of the outgoing batsman. Back of a length and explodes from the pitch outside off, Azhar jumps off the ground and is airborne as he desperately fends at the ball. Gloves it through to de Kock diving away to his right. Vicious bounce. What a miserable tour for Azhar Ali
Olivier greets Babar with another prancing delivery, Babar sways out of the way
pitched up and angling in at off, 137ks, played back to the bowler
back of a length on middle, shuffles across and works to the leg side
back of a length, angling in and straightening away as Shafiq spars at the ball and misses
full and veering into the pads, glanced away fine of long leg for four
back of a length and angling in, 143ks, this one keeps low, Shafiq goes low with it and keeps it out
shortish and outside off, punched to short cover. Hamza, the debutant, throws the stumps down at the non-striker's end but Shafiq has reached the safety of his crease
short and slanting in from wide of the crease, Shafiq hops, skips, and fends it off
back of a length and outside off, stabbed away in the gap between backward point and gully for four
lifter outside off, Shafiq ducks under it
picked off the pads through square leg for four. Chipped in the air to short leg's right
bumper, the batsman ducks under it, de Kock throws himself to his left to collect the ball
full and on off, Shafiq gets right behind the line and defends tightly
on a length and outside off, Babar presses it to the covers
back of a length and outside off, punched up to the covers
short and wide, crashed straight to point off the back foot
full and straight, delightfully driven between midwicket and mid-on. Babar has timed it to perfection
short and outside off, Babar skips back and smites a pull over midwicket. Bam!
full on off, defended
back of a length and outside off, punched away to the left of short cover
short and outside off, 136ks, does not bounce as much as Babar expected it to. Sneaks under his pull. Was there a deflection there? Off the trouser and through to the diving keeper
full and right up Babar's driving arc. He lunges out and creams it through extra-cover. Whoa
Olivier nearly rips out the glove! Jumps from a length, comes back in, and pings the top glove, then the bottom glove
Babar stays leg-side of this short ball outside off and cracks it away through cover-point. Punched away with great authority
short and outside off, this does not bounce much, Babar sways his upper body out of the way
pitched up and outside off, delectable cover drive. Shafiq leans into it and lets his hands flow through the line
back of a length and angling in from outside off, left alone
short and outside off, Babar throws his bat at it and does not connect with the ball
su-weeet cover driving. Full and outside off, eased in the gap. Hamza chases it hard and tracks the ball down even with pads on
short and extra width, Shafiq pounces onto it and smears it away through point for four. Cut away off the back foot to the left of the fielder
back of a length and skids back in at 140kph to smack the pad
full and too straight, knocked away to long leg
on a length and just a shade outside off, blocked solidly
full on the pads, tucked around the corner
short on the body, fended to the leg side off the back foot
looks like a fast legbreak outside off, forced to short cover
short and outside off, Babar rises on top of the ball and punches on the up but can't get it past short cover
very full and tails in a touch on off, draws a leading edge to mid-off
full and rolls through to the keeper as the batsman lets it go
full and slanting into middle, Shafiq stretches out and chips the ball to mid-on
full and attacking the stumps, 137ks, played back down the pitch
back of a length and strikes the splice as the batsman loosens his grip and fends it back
too full and straight straight, a whirl of the wrists sends the ball away to the left of deep midwicket. Good work in the outfield for Markram late in the day
back of a length and holds its line outside off, a back-foot force to mid-off ensues

fast legbreak outside off, takes the outside edge and rolls to the third man region. They hare across for three. Bavuma chases hard and throws it to de Kock, who already had his gloves off; he effects a direct hit at the non-striker's end, but Shafiq is in
floated full and outside off, driven to short cover
back of a length and kicks up outside off, tickled away to gully
Babar shuffles across and defends this length ball on middle to the leg side
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Babar gets right behind the line and blocks
bouncer outside off, Shafiq arches his back and lets it go
another one dug into the middle of the pitch, Shafiq evades it
back of a length and wider of off, Shafiq ignores it
fuller and on a fourth-stump line, pushed to the covers off the front foot
very full on off, jabbed to the leg side
short on top of off, Babar gets right behind the line and keeps it out to round out the day
bouncer at an off stump line, ducks under it
yorker just outside off. Jammed into the leg side off the inside half

falls short of mid-off! Babar will always go for the pull. Almost costs him this time. It's not as short as he thinks it is. And it's wide and seaming away outside off. Half-pull and it lobs off the toe-end as he checks the shot. Mid-off won't get there
short and wide outside off, left alone
short at off stump, defended on the back foot
hits the right bicep or possibly the right side of the chest as he drops the bat to let this pass. Short ball dips in at him
great hands from Shafiq. 23rd fifty for him. Overpitched delivery at leg stump. Leans in and uses delicate hands to turn this square of square leg with a flick
full at off stump, blocked on the front foot
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length at off stump, dead-batted into the off side
length ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball slanted in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
short ball rises steeply in the corridor. Drops the gloves and lets it go
length ball outside off, left alone
outside edge past second slip. Short ball up in the corridor. Looks to punch but that gets too big on him. Thick edge flies wide of the cordon

got him! Doesn't give you a chance, this guy! Short ball again. Just gets so steep when he hits that length, more so than any other bowler in this line-up. Babar wants to get on the back foot to defend this. It's not a bad option at all. But it gets to throat height and he can't control it from there. A glove and QDK takes a simple catch

bowled him! He continues this double-wicket over trend! Third time for him in the Test. Sarfraz is hanging back in the crease expecting a bouncer. They've just brought in short leg. It's a trap. This is a short of a length and ball and it tonks the top of off, coming in with the angle. Sarfraz is too late on the defence
shot! Length ball in at off stump, and a good forward stride to punch firmly on the up past the bowler
spanked away. Loose bowling from Philander. Short, wide, not too quick. Stands up and runs his hands through this, on the rise, through the covers
length at leg stump, flicked into the leg side
length ball just outside off, punched on the up to mid-on
falls short of mid-on. Short of a length outside off. Looks to pull off the front foot, it dips to mid-on's right
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
length at leg stump, defended into the leg side
short ball in the corridor, ducks under it
short ball wide outside off, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
short of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, arches into the leg side and chops this handsomely to deep point's left. Looking good
short ball at off stump, ducks under it. Front-foot no-ball as well
short ball down leg side, left alone
length ball just outside off, pushed to point off the outside half
length ball just outside off, defended off the back foot. Inside half of the bat
keeps low. Length ball has likely hit a crack outside off. Looks to punch through the line but this skids under the bat
past the outside edge. Length ball outside off, draws him in on the front foot and jags it away
another one stays low. Cracks cracks cracks. Length ball just outside off, looks to punch through cover and this is almost ankle height as it rolls through to the keeper
length and in at the corridor. Low again. Gets on the back foot and jabs it into the covers
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length at off stump, defended down the pitch from deep in the crease
short of a length outside off, nicely behind the line to cut to point's right
falls short or deep backward point. Rabada spots it late. It's an upper cut. Good looking upper cut too, but ill-advised. Slices it up and Rabada takes it on the bounce
bouncer at an off stump line. Quickly crouches to get out of the way
short of a length just outside off, defended into the covers

taken at second slip. Was a matter of time before one went up instead of down. Length outside off. Gets forward to defend. Perhaps stretching out a little too far away from the body, but that's a marginal shout. It gets big on him and he fends to Elgar. Replays show he walked down at that too
length at middle stump, languidly pushed into the leg side off the front foot
length at off stump, blocked into the covers
short of third slip. Short of a length just outside off. Not enough room for the cut, which he has attempted. Jams his glove as it drops to De Bruyn's left at third slip
length ball just outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
top edge sails over the keeper. Faheem playing the shot that got him out in the first innings. Short and climbing at the helmet. Swipes and swivels. Safe this time
short and slanted across off stump. Uses the angle to get on top of the bounce and slice it wide of gully
short ball angled into the corridor. Looks to pull that. In woeful position. Beaten by pace as this skids hip height
short ball down leg side, ducks under it
short of a length and in at leg stump. Looks to flick, cops it on the thigh
short of a length just outside off. Hurriedly nudged into the covers off the back foot
short ball down leg side, can't get bat on the glance
length ball just outside off, pushes with hard hands on the front foot. Thick edge to gully
length ball just outside off, leans in and jabs this wide of cover
length ball shaping away wide outside off, left alone
length ball, slight shape away from off stump. Defended into the off side on the front foot. Hard hands again
short of a length at leg stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
length outside off, blocked into the off side
short and jumping away outside off. Loses his shape as he flails at this and is beaten
short of a length on leg stump, on the back foot to stab this wide of mid-on
short ball down leg side, lets that slide
shot. Takes on the bouncer and unlike the first innings, he adds four to Olivier's runs column with the hook this time. Short, up the chest, and a nice swivel to place this where he wants

in front of square this time. They put in a square leg halfway in from the boundary, so he needed to go in front of the stumps this time. Keeps his eyes on this short ball and drags it through midwicket as it slants across him
bouncer at off stump. Gets too big for him to attempt the hook this time
short of a length at the pads, whipped to deep square
short of a length and in at off stump. Tapped to point off the back foot
length outside off, sliced to backward point on the rise
short of a length and in at leg stump, swivels and pulls to fine leg's right
length outside off, punched on the rise to mid-off
short ball up at the throat. Hooks uppishly, but safely in front of deep square
length ball outside off, driven on the rise into the covers
length outside off, punched to extra cover on the up

oh great catch! Markram at wide gully. He's not squatting like a normal cordon fielder does. On his toes and walking in, ever so slightly as the bowler runs in. Then he gets static and is ready to spring at it with a crouch as Faheem looks to cut a ball that is too close for the cut. It flies high to Markram's left but his initial momentum from the faux walk-in means he is in a good position to explode to his left. And he does it. And he gets two hands at it to grab on. Tumbles gracefully to his left to arrest the momentum too. Superb.
mighty full and fizzing away outside off at 144ks, squeezes under the bat and goes to the keeper
bouncer, slanting away outside off, 141ks, Amir sways his upper body out of the way
really full and speared outside off at 143ks, a crease-bound Amir drives weakly... and misses
good length and moving in at off, 141ks, Shadab presses forward and plays it back to Steyn
on a length and sharply angling into off, 140ks, Shadab ventures forward and across as he bunts the ball towards mid-on
back of a length and on off, Shadab gets right behind the line and blocks carefully
much fuller nibbling away outside off, 139ks, left alone
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Shadab gently runs it away towards point
on a length and on a fifth-sixth stump line outside off, no shot
short, wide outside off, Amir throws his bat at it and slashes it up and over gully. No protection at third man to cut that off

Grabbed by Markram at gully, but this is a much simpler catch. Back of a length and on a sixth-stump line, not as short as the previous delivery. Amir chases after it and slices an edge to Markram. SA two wickets away from 3-0
fuller and outside off, Hasan sits back, opens the face, and secures a single to the covers
back of a length and slanting into middle, Shadab shuffles across off stump and pats the ball to mid-on
Rabada bangs a bouncer on middle, 138ks, Shadab ducks under it safely
Shadab rides the bounce of this 140ks short ball outside off and drops it to gully
full and homing in at off stump, Steyn hits 145ks, Hasan covers up in defence
shorter and outside off, Hasan attempts a pull and ends up flat-batting it in the air past the outstretched right hand of Steyn in his followthrough
much fuller, angling in, then veering away late past the outside edge. Hasan was completely opened up by Steyn
full and curves in on middle and leg, 145ks, Hasan presses forward and chips it in the air but wide of mid-on
Steyn hits 140ks, Hasan leans into this full one outside off and drives to left of Olivier at short cover
banged in short and outside off, 140ks, Hasan goes after it and splices it up and over point
wide of the crease, angling into the hips, glanced away to short leg's right
Rabada hits 140ks, Hasan doesn't care. He has a roundhouse swipe at it and sends it sailing into the empty stands beyond midwicket. Bam!
back of a length and angling into a smooth push through vacant mid-on
on the pads, Shadab can't get the flick away
Shadab gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches up to cover
full and angling into middle, defended back to the bowler
short and outside off, keeps low, draws the edge but does not carry to the keeper
pitched up and outside off, leans into a drive and places it to the left of Hamza at mid-off
short and just a shade outside off, Shadab gets right behind the line and blocks to cover
on a length and straightens outside off, Shadab dangles his bat out and edges it between slips and gully for four
edged again, but this slice runs away between point and cover
back of a length and on off, Shadab gets back and punches to point
bouncer, angling in on middle, Hasan ducks under it
short and banged down leg as Hasan gets out of the way once again
Hasan looks away, ducks into a 142ks short ball, catches the glove and loops over gully

Rabada calls for the catch and takes it himself! 146ks short ball aimed at the chest, Hasan is hurried into a hook. He can only top-edge it in the air. The ball drops down into the lap of Rabada. He collects it near the midwicket region. SA one away from 3-0
yorker, tails in on off, 145ks, Abbas jams it out
Abbas looks away from a back of a length ball, he expects a proper bouncer. Rolls off the shoulder of the bat and sneaks away past the cordon
full on off, blocked to mid-off
shorter and outside off, stabbed to the covers
back of a length and ducks back in, inside-edged onto the pad

short and swerves away outside off, 140ks, Shadab swings his hands at a pull. Steyn thinks there was a noise. Not given by umpire Wilson. Elgar asks for a review. Nah, not bat involved. Steyn and de Kock exchange wry smiles. Steyn gesticulates: it's on you, de Kock
jabbed away to short cover, a direct hit could have had Abbas at the striker's end
lifter on middle, Abbas rocks his head out of the way
back of a length and outside off, 142ks, punched on the up to short cover
on a length and outside off, played to the covers
shorter and outside off, fenced to gully on the bounce
Shadab rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and secures a single to point
full and nips back in at 143ks, catches Abbas in the crease, umpire Ravi shoots down the lbw appeal. Heading down leg. SA have exhausted their reviews
back of a length and bends back in, inside-edged to fine leg
on a length and outside off, Shadab presses forward and dead-bats it away
kicks up from a length on off, off the shoulder of the bat and wanders away to third man
dug in short and outside off, 146ks, Shadab splices a pull over the top of mid-on
good length and angling in on middle, stoutly defended back to Steyn
shortish and outside off, crisply punched to cover

Shadab arches back, meets this 141ks short ball outside off, and ramps is smartly over the cordon for four. Pace can be your friend. Pace can also be your enemy. Nice, little innings from Shadab, this
on a length and snakes in, off the inside half and rolls away to the right of short leg
gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches away to deep point. Shadab hares back for the second
Shadab jabs away from the body and under-edges it to gully
bouncer from wide of the crease, Shadab ducks under it
short and wide outside off, Shadab leaps and batters it up and over point. Scythed away with both feet in the air
Shadab aims to duck into a short ball angling in at off, then defends belatedly and keeps it out
full and holds its line outside off, left alone
lifter just a shade outside off, 142ks, Abbas ducks out of the way
short and on leg stump, Abbas ducks again. Steyn cranks it up to 145ks
pitched up and outside off, driven straight off mid-on off the front foot
on a length on off, 143ks, Shadab presses forward and blocks solidly
full and outside off, Shadab gets forward, opens the face, and deftly runs it away between gully and point
sloppy stuff from gully. Abbas rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and fends it to Markram, who misfields and lets Abbas off strike
short at the body, short-armed away to deep midwicket off the back foot
back of a length and shoved down the leg side, away from the reach of Abbas' flick
fuller and outside off, tickled to gully
kicks up from a back of a length outside off, fended off
full-toss dipping in to take the pad, not given by S Ravi. But this seems to be heading down leg and SA have exhausted their reviews
full on off, backs away outside leg and drills to deep cover does Shadab
dangled up on off, 77ks, very full, dead-batted away by Abbas
donkey drop, lands just a shade outside off, defended. 76ks

A mix-up between the wickets and that aptly sums up Pakistan's tour. SA sweep them 3-0! Tossed full around off, forced away towards mid-on, Abbas risks a single, he's eventually sent back by Shadab. Horrible running. Markram, I think, swoops down on the ball and throws it to de Kock, who finishes off the game
